title: Total Drama Dungeon Pilot Episode.
description:
Scripts: MousAI Party Chat I
Credits: Special thanks to 𝔗𝔥𝔢 ℭ𝔲𝔩𝔱 for beta testing.

actions.text: Location: Some random summer camp. This is where 14 players divided into 2 teams will be battling out for 100,000 scales by competing in challenges, and at the end of a challenge, the loosing team will vote someone off. Welcome, to Total! Drama! Dungeon!
A bus with some of the contestants stops by, opening its doors to drop them off as everyone exits
> Raichu says "And here come some of the contestants now"
A strange, purple furred creature with four catlike ears on top of their head, a long, fluffy tail and four mandibles like a tarantula comes out of the bus. They're tightly holding a teddy bear.

> Raichu says "Oooook?"

> Raichu says "._."

After some waiting, a slightly overweight man walks out of the bus. He´s using overly formal clothes and has an smug smile on his face.

"Hi, my name is Sean Anthony," the guy says in a peculiar, almost unintelligible voice.

> Raichu says "Everyone see the mud pit over there? *points in a random direction*"
> CodySir looks in the direction Raichu pointed.

title: A Cheerful Trainee
description:
Another scenario based on my adventures. This time the prompt was (shamelesly) copied from it.

It's a nice, open ended setting, with cat-nip formatted characters (for those who were asking). I might add a little WI tomorrow with places and souch. (Feel free to recommend anything in the comments.)

Oh, remember to add stuff to the pin and the WI as you play.
memory:
[ SETTING: fantasy, steampunk.][ The world is broken into islands.][ you live in Doralia.][ you need an airship to travel from island to island.][ you are in the city of Agramoor.][ you are in the Empire's territory.][ Ruby summary:< full name≡ Ruby von Ageir>/< gender≡ female>.][ Ruby appearance: <skinny>/<eyes≡bright red>/<hair≡curly red>.][ Ruby mental:< happy& cheerful& naive/ childish& curious>.][ Ruby relationship: <you≡trainee.]
[ you know about diverse themes like history, philosophy, the art of war.][ you often put Ruby in dangerous situations to train her.]

worldInfo.entry: [Doralia: fantasy, steampunk;][Doralia is a land of floating islands, connected by massive bridges and networks of smaller ropes.] [Airships fly between islands, bringing commerce between the countries and people on the islands.]

[Empire: The Empire of the Skies is the strongest military in Doralia.][Though they are not the most powerful country, the Empire of the Skies has the largest army. ][The Empire of the Skies is constantly looking for new technology with which to strengthen their aerial army.][They are also very isolationist and do not get along well with other countries.]

[Aramoor: Aramooria is the Empire of the Skies' capital island.][The country of Aramooria is run by the Emperor and his Council.][It is a peaceful city where residents live in marble palaces and aristocrats frequent the tea shops.]

[ you relationship: <Ruby≡instructor.][ you teach Ruby.][ you summary:< full name≡Richard van Astrea>/< gender≡ male>.][ you mental:< tired& professional& calm/ lazy& cold>.][ you trait:< skills≡ swordmanship& time magic.]

actions.text:
A teenage girl with long curly red hair and bright red eyes looks up at you from her chair. She immediately gets up and hugs you.
"You came back!" she says with a huge smile. "When?"
"Just a few minutes ago. I'm here to train you."
"That's so great! I was wondering when I would see you again." The girl has really nice hugs.
"Well, I'm here now." You sit down at the desk and motion her to do likewise. "I think we should start with some introductions, don't you agree?"
"Yes!" the girl beams. "I'm Ruby, by the way. Are you going to teach me arcane arts?"
"No, I'm really bad with magic and all that 'smart people' stuff, so you will have to find someone else to teach you about that topic." You motion for her to stop.
"Oh" Ruby frowns a bit and pouts "I was hoping you would be the one who would do it."
You laugh. "I aim to disappoint. Now, shall we get started?"
"Sure! Whatever you say! I'll be happy to learn whatever you want to teach me."
"Alright then," you lean over and look at one of the many notebooks on her desk. "What would you like to know?"
"Oh, well I'd like to know more about the world and... well... some magic!" She states the last bit with great enthusiasm.
"Okay then," you flip open the notebook and start writing. "What would you like to know about the world?"
"Well... I'd like to know how it got to the state it's in now."
You start drawing a rough map.
"The world used to be a much smaller size, with a lot more land. Then the Old Man came and did something with magic I guess, and it made the world bigger."
"That's so strange! I didn't know that."
"Yeah, it was strange at the time, even by Old Man standards. Now the world is broken up into islands. Some have airships, some don't. Some have magic, some don't. It's a crazy world and it's getting crazier. You should see some of the places the airships have crashed into."
"That must have been so cool!" Ruby looks at you with great interest. "Do you go to such places?"
"No," you shake your head with a smile. "
An airship is a dangerous place to be, too much can go wrong. I stay away from the places where trouble tends to congregate.

Who knows, maybe when I'm done with this, I can go explore some of these far away places myself."
"You would go on an airship?"
"I've been on one,

remember?"
"Oh... yeah. I forgot." Ruby smiles.
"Anyway, the world eventually settled into the state it's in now. Some ages are shorter than others, that's just how it is.
Some nations lasted longer than others, but in the end it was all just part of the cycle. Nowadays the world goes to war, and when an age ends, a new one begins.

And so it goes."
"That sounds like a really old world. How do you know all this?"
"Because it's true. Do you have any other questions?

"Yeah, lots of them," Ruby says with a smirk.
"Well, you can't avoid learning unless you don't want to, now you're going to have to put up with me."

"That's okay, I'd still like to learn."
"Well, you can't force yourself to learn unless you want to... Did I say that right?"
"Yes, you did," Ruby laughs.

"So what do you want to know?"
"Well, I was thinking about the Old Man. I was wondering what his motives were."
"What do you mean?"

"Well, do you know why he did what he did?"
"Not really. I mean, he told me that he was doing it to test us, but other than that he refused to discuss the matter."

"What do you think he was really doing?"
"I don't know. Do you have an answer to that question?"
"Not one that I'd care to admit to."
> You say "Well, I think you have learnt enough history for today, what if we do something else?"

"What did you have in mind?"
"How about a little test?"
"A test?" Ruby says with a frown.

"Don't worry, it's a good test. Now, put your head against my heart and listen to the rhythm of my heart."
"What's this for?"
"You'll see."

Ruby complies with your request and places her head against your chest. You gently rub her back as you gently rock her slightly from side to side.
"What are you doing?"

"Just relax, you're tensing up. Just close your eyes and listen to the sound of my heart."
"Okay."
Ruby closes her eyes while you begin to gently rock her in your arms. Your eyes briefly glance over to the mirror over your bed, you see her face light up as she listens intently to your heart.

You've never noticed it before, but her heartbeat is exactly synchronised with your own.
"Can you hear it?"
"Yes," Ruby says in a daze.

You continue to gently rock her as she begins to fall asleep. After a couple more minutes you quietly pull her up, knowing that she needs to be awake for the test.
"Ruby wake up."

"Huh?" Ruby says groggily.
"Here, I think you've passed the test."
You slowly slide a silver ring onto her finger, it fits perfectly.
"It's beautiful."

"You can really hear my heart?"
"As I said, if we listen closely, we can hear it."
"Can we do the test again just to make sure?"
> You say "Hmm? Why though, there is no need"

"I just want to be sure," Ruby says.
"I don't understand."
"Sometimes adults don't believe me, I'd like to prove it to you somehow."
> You say "You don't need to prove anyrthing to me"

"Well... I just want to make sure." Ruby says in a somewhat dejected tone.
You chuckle slightly and hug her tightly.
"Don't worry about it, or anything else for that matter, you're going to grow up to be a wonderful woman Ruby. You don't have to prove anything to me, I believe you."

"Thank you for trusting me."
"There's nothing to worry about, now let's get some rest, we have a big day ahead of us tomorrow."
After saying goodnight to Ruby, you retire to your own bed. You drift off to sleep with the thought of seeing Ruby again in the morning.
The next day brought with it a pounding headache and a race to get ready for the day before. You spent no time at all in trying on all the different outfits you had.

You ended up choosing something very formal that you knew Ruby would be able to wear.
"The sooner we get this started the quicker we can both get back to taking care of more important matters."

You mutter to yourself as you head downstairs to get your father and tell him that you're leaving.
When you enter the kitchen, you're surprised to find Ruby there cleaning up.

She's even wearing the same dress she had on yesterday.
"I thought you would be finishing up packing or getting ready to leave earlier." You say.
"I finished up yesterday afternoon. I just wanted to make sure everything was in order for you."
> You say "Oh, ok. We will leave soon, be sure to double check all your baggage"
"Thanks for yesterday. It was really fun and I learned so much, I think we should do it again sometime just so I can practice all the stuff you taught me."

"Would you like some breakfast first?"
"Um... no, I shouldn't keep you from your work."
"It's ok, you can eat when you're ready."

You quickly finish packing up and exit the inn.
"Are we ready to go?" you ask your Ruby who is already waiting at the carriage.

"Yes, let's go!" She reaches her hand out and you lift her up into the carriage.
You climb up and sit opposite her on the way to

the next town.
"So what did you want to do now that you're awake early?"
"I wanted to practice my sword fighting." Ruby grins.

"Of course, are you going to be able to do all the stuff you did yesterday?"
"Probably not, but I'll give it my best shot!"
You spend the next couple hours or so having fun teaching Ruby how to play "fetch" using various colored ribbons. It's really funny how completely obsessed she gets over them.
By the time you're finished it's starting to get dark and you realize that you've gotten privy to a beautiful park with a small fountain.

You suggest that it would be a good spot to camp for tonight.
Ruby goes on about how nice the park is and how she hopes you'll come here often to relax.

"It's a shame we'll have to leave when we wake up." Ruby says looking at the sunset.
"I don't want to, I'm having so much fun!"

"I would like to make the most of our time together. We can talk more in the morning, ok?"
"Sure." Ruby gives you a quick hug and lies down on her sleeping bag.
You sit and think about what you're going to talk to Ruby about when she wakes up.

You're too nervous to fall asleep, so you spend a few more hours sitting up thinking.
"You sleep on the ground like a common hob." A deep voice says.

You turn to see a large man wearing armor standing about ten feet away.
"Who are you?" You ask.

"It doesn't matter who I am, you thief. You think you can just come in here and take what is mine?" he says.
"Huh?

No, I mean..." you stutter standing up. "I was just gonna sleep in the park, not steal anything."
"Then what are you doing here?"

"I wanted to ask Ruby to go to the fair with me."
You can sense the man rolling his eyes.
"Are you sure you want to go out with a thief?" he asks.
"I'd almost rather go out with a thief than a gross old man." A voice comes from behind you.

You turn to see a young woman, about your age, in front of you. She has long curly red hair and wears a tiny red dress.
"He's not that old."

You protest.
"I'm twenty, that's old." The woman says.
"I'm Marik, what are you doing here?" the man asks.
"I asked first," you say.

"And I wanted to ask Ruby to the fair."
"What's your name?" Marik asks.
"I'm asking you."
Marik puts his face in his hand.

memory: [ SETTING: <fantasy& dark& horror/ medieval.][ WRITING STYLE: comedic, descriptive, dense.][ you summary:< full name≡ Ricky>< species≡ catfolk>/< gender≡ female>.][ you mental:< jester& nonchalant>.]

actions.text: You are Ricky, a knight living in the kingdom of Larion. You have a steel longsword and a wooden shield. You are on a quest to defeat the evil dragon of Larion. You've heard he lives up at the north of the kingdom. You set on the path to defeat him and walk into a dark forest. As you enter the forest you see
a large dragon flying above you. He breathes fire at you, causing you to duck and run back onto the path. You look up to see the dragon has flown further up into the sky.
You look back down at the path and begin to run up it as fast as you can, hoping to outrun the dragon. As you run, you see a large black and red beast pop out of the forest.

A black dragon. You knew there was another one!
The two of you continue your race up the path.
The black dragon is slightly smaller than the other one, and emits less fire. As you run up the path, you see a large castle in the distance. Hopefully, it's yours.
The two of you reach the castle and, as you had hoped, it is yours. There is a large moat surrounding it, and you have to wade through it to get to the castle itself.
You run as fast as you can, diving into the moat. By the time the black dragon reaches the edge of the moat, it is on fire and attempting to dive into the water.
> You say "Do not urinate on the moat, so they say..."
The moat is very old and has lead pipes in it to channel the water into it. As the dragon is attempting to dive, these pipes burst, spraying the dragon with a mixture of freezing cold water and lead.
The dragon, confused and freezing cold, quickly swims back to the edge of the moat. Standing on the edge for a moment, it breathes fire on the ground in an attempt to melt through.

It works, and the dragon begins to dive forward into the water.
As it does, you grab your sword and plunge it into the back of the dragon's head.
> You say "Gotcha"
The dragon flails about in the water for a moment, before beginning to swim towards the bottom of the moat.
You follow it, slicing through the dragon's hide repeatedly. Finally, you grab hold of one side of the dragon and pull yourself to the other side of the moat.
You sit there, covered in dragon blood and ichors, and stare at the dragon's corpse. The moat was a simple moat, but it was just large enough to drown a dragon.
> You say "Now what do I do"
You raise your sword and begin to look for the dragon's heart.
Eventually, you find it, between its wings. You grab the heart and hold it up for inspection. It is red, with bones, teeth and sinew still attached to it.
> You consume the dragon's heart.
You eat the dragon's heart. You feel a surge of energy course through your body.
"This is it!" you think. "I'm finally going to be able to expand my powers and break free of this curse!"

Your power increases.
"I can feel things more clearly now. The wind against my fur, the sun on my skin, the colours more vivid... I'm one with nature!"

You laugh.
"Now to find the orcs and free them from the Empire!"
You laugh again, as you run into the forest.
"I will lead them to victory against the Empire! We will live in harmony with nature, and you will all be free!"
You laugh one more time as you run through the forest, heading for the nearest orc village.
You run all day, stopping only to drink from the river or eat fruit from the trees. You laugh as you run, imagining all the territory that the orcs will win for the rightful owners.

You run all night, arriving at the village in the morning. You laugh, pounding your chest.
"I am the chosen of the forest! I am one with nature, and nature is my chosen!"
Several large tents are set up in the village. You walk towards them, preparing speeches on how the Empire has mistreated the orcs, how it is the cause of all their troubles.
You have to pick the perfect timing, before you are to lead the orcs into battle against them. It must be a just battle.
You reach the tents. One of them has a large piece of leather hanging from it, and appears to be used as a door. You walk towards it, preparing to go inside.

"Oy! You there!" a voice cries.
"Pah! Let the shadows embrace you! It is dark, and you are fearful!" you say.

"Shut it, lizard! I'm talking to you!" the voice says.
You pause, and close your mouth.
"Yes?" you ask.
> You say "and I'm not a lizard, bigot"

"I'm not a big fan of your kind," the voice continues, "so I've been told. My name's Klint. What's yours?"
"Ricky," you say.

"It is a common name. Are you human, then?"
"No, I'm not human,

I'm a... I'm a..."
"What are you, some sort of reptilian lizard?" Klint asks.
"I don't look like a lizard, I mean, I'm covered in hair,

so people tend to make that assumption, but I'm not a lizard," you say.
"That's the second time you've told me that.

Either you're a lizard, or you're not. If you're not, then why are you covered in hair? Are you a reptile?"
"I'm a... I'm a creature of the forest!

I was born from it! We're not of this world! You must understand, Klint!"
"I'm not sure I want to," Klint says.
"Well, let me try again.

I'm a forest creature!"
"A forest creature? Interesting," Klint says. "I was going to sleep, so is there a point to this?"

"The Empire is killing my forest!"
Klint leans out of his tent, looking at the canopy of the forest.
"There's a lot of trees in that forest. Maybe they're killing it," Klint says.
"No, no, they've been cutting the trees for years. My people have been suffering because of it. I want you to stop them."
"You want me to stop cutting trees?" Klint asks incredulously. "That's a little contradictory there, mate."

"They're harming the environment! They're killing off all the wildlife! They say they're going to implement order, but really they just want to graze their cattle in the forest and chop down the trees!"
"Oh, so you're a rancher, then? Got any grazing land you'd like to sell me?" Klint says snidely.
> You say "I don't like your tone, Klint"

Klint pulls his head back into the tent.
"Sorry, mate. I just get a lot of hostility from forest creatures," Klint says. "I try to protect this camp."
"How long have you and your men been setting up camp here?" you ask.
"A couple of weeks. We were going to pass through, but it's the least damaged country left, and it has the best wildlife to graze on it. There's plenty of water for our animals too."
You nod. You've seen the damage the Empire has been doing, and Klint is right to be fearful of them. His men haven't suffered at all even though they've been passing through ruined land.
They'd probably suffer severely if they had to settle down in the less damaged regions.
"So, you're a rancher. You take it upon yourself to destroy the forest?"
> You say "NO, stop calling me a rancher, bigot"
"Sorry," Klint says, shrugging. "I'll try to restrain myself in the future."
You grunt in response, as it's a pointless request. Klint's men waste no time in starting their fire, which spews out a plume of black smoke that engulfs you.
You raise an arm to shield your eyes from the intense smoke, and are shocked when it suddenly disappears.

You blink, and it's not there. A quick glance to either side confirms that your allies also have the same ability.
"What the hell is this, some kind of magic trick?"

Klint says.
"It's... a gift," you answer, struggling for words.

"A gift, huh?"
Klint stares at you for a moment, and then bursts out laughing.
"Just like a rancher!" he laughs. "Making something out of nothing! God, I'm going to have such a good time making up your death, you little fraud!"
> You say "What do you mean with that? And stop calling me a rancher!"

"Ah, I get it. You can make things out of nothing. Hah! Let me guess: you were born with this power, is that it?"
"It's not funny."
With a flick of his wrist, Klint causes your horse to whirl around and bite him viciously on the ankle, nearly ripping his leg off.

He screams as his friends beat him to the ground.
"Stop! Stop! You're killing him!" you yell.
"Pfft," Klint says, spitting out a chunk of flesh.

"He should be grateful. If he dies, I get another mount. If he survives, he's a wanderer in the wilderness."
"It's not funny!" you shout. "He could've been killed!"

"Life's not funny. Sorry, mate. Good luck out here."
You turn to leave, but the man you came to talk to is already gone.
You feel incredibly powerless here. What can you do to stop all this? You suppose you could run away and try to survive, but where would you go?
How would you survive? You have no idea how you're going to survive, but there's nothing else for it. Equipment shortages and fighting on constantly, with no relief in sight. That's soldier life.
> You say "Maybe I should go to a church"
You're not sure about the Empire, but the Church is another matter. If there's any group that can be relied on to help out the people...you've just entered a small town.
You find yourself staring at a small, wooden building with a spike lying on top of it. That spike is probably the most amazing thing about it, because it's small and barely protrudes above the roof.

(It also serves as the roof for the church, which makes it even more amazing.) Perhaps this church could be a good start.
You approach and open the squeaky front door with the spike, entering inside.
The inside of the church is surprisingly clean, though you're not exactly surprised by that.
There's a wooden pew at the front of the church, with a cross lying in front of it, and that's about it. There are two doors on the far wall, and you head towards the back.
There, you find another pew, this one wooden and padded, and a lectern at the front. You seat yourself in the padded pew, focusing on the crosses out the window.
It occurs to you as you stare at them that these crosses were probably a source of comfort for the dying, when they were just wooden sticks on a hill.

Now, they're a symbol of a painful death.
You feel a pain in your chest, and cough up a bit of blood.

You stand up, walking over to the door, and press your ear against it. You hear nothing but silence.
You sit back down, and grab the bible that's in front of you.
You start to read a few pages, but give up after a few minutes. Nothing but stories about people doing bad things to each other. You close it, and rest your head against the back of the chair.
You watch as a large bird perches on one of the outside poles, looking at you. You consider making a grab for it, but decide against it; real soldiers don't try to grab the first thing they see.

You're no longer a real soldier.
The door opens as a young girl, barely older than sixteen, walks in. You immediately stand up, saluting.
"Sir!" you say.

"At ease. You're not actually in military anymore."
She stares at you in silence for a few moments, as the other soldiers in the church look on. Then she laughs.
"You're actually real."
You nod. "Yes, ma'am. I was discharged. What are you doing here? Shouldn't you be at school?"

She shakes her head. "It's Sunday. It's our day off. What are you doing here?"
You shrug.

"I could ask you the same thing. I never knew this church even had a daycare."
"We have lots of things you don't know about." She points to a small crib in the corner.

"There's a few babies in there. I'm looking after them while their parents go to church."
"That's...pretty observant of you," you say, not knowing what else to say.

"My parents are observant. I learned from them." She walks towards you, staring at you. "You're not like the others, you know."
What did she mean by that?

Were there other people like you in the world?
"You're from the outside. I can tell. You don't talk like the others."
"How do I talk?" you ask.
She laughs.

"You don't talk at all, actually. But you say it perfectly."
"Perfectly?"
She nods. "For a non-believer, you say every prayer perfectly."
You frown.
"I'm not a non-believer. I just don't consider myself a believer."

She snorts. "Of course not. You're too nice to be one of them."
"What do you mean?"

"They're all mean. I swear, they're worse than Catholics." She rolls her eyes. "They're like little kids, just without any of the...well, you know."
You nod slowly.

"Are you one too?"
"Oh, no. I'm saving myself for marriage. And my parents would have my head if I got pregnant before then." She bites her lip.

"You...don't think my parents would mind if I talked to you for a little while? It's okay if you don't want to say anything back."
You nod. "Sure. Go ahead."

"Thanks!" She quickly ducks under the table, and you hear the soft patter of footsteps as she runs around the room.
You hear a soft laugh as she whispers, "I'm Felicity."

A few minutes later, Felicity crawls back out from under the table. She stands up and stretches, before frowning and saying, "I have to go now."
You nod. "Of course."

She smiles. "Thanks for letting me talk to you!"
"You're welcome."
She giggles and waves, before running out of the room and out of the church.
You watch her go, and after she leaves you head to the nursery. You look at the cribs; there are five of them. Three male and two female. They're all about a month old.

Three of them are awake, although one of them is just crying softly.
The father glances at you, nodding encouragingly. "It's okay, guys. Your Mommy and your Grandpa are here."

He smiles at you as he picks up the crying baby. "Come on, honey. Let's give him to Grandpa."
You look at the mother, who looks back at you with nervousness.

"Is he...is he okay?" she asks nervously. "He's so tiny."
Her husband smiles and places the baby in your arms.

"He's perfect. Thank you, ma'am."
You nod. "You're welcome."

He smiles. "I'm sorry, but we need to go now. Thank you, sir."
He walks quickly to the door, and opens it for his wife and infant child.
The father nods to you, and quickly leaves. The mother walks over to you, and smiles nervously. "I...I'm sorry for my baby's crying. My body is just readjusting to be a parent."
She looks at you, biting her lip nervously. "I don't mean to stare, but..." She blushes profusely as she asks, "Do you mind if I ask how old you are?"

"I'm eighteen," you say.
She bites her lip nervously once more. "I'm fifteen."
"You're pregnant."
She bites her lip and nods.
You frown and say,

"You don't have to marry him. You're not in love with him."
She nods.

"I know. I'll...I'll stay married to him. Just not for the sake of the child."
You nod. "I understand."
She sighs and looks at you.

"I'll...I'll miss you."
You nod. "I'll miss you, too."
She looks down and bites her lip nervously. After a moment, she smiles and nods. "Bye."
She waves, and then turns and quickly leaves the room. You watch her leave, before looking down at her child. You smile, and hold the child in your arms.

You look forward to the future.
You know you'll be a good father.
> You get out of the church, dissapointed because you didn't find any voluptuous nuns.

You walk out of the church, disappointed. You're not even in the next town yet, what's the point of getting married if you're not going to have fun with it?
"What are you waiting for?"

a voice calls out.
You turn your head to see a young boy, no older than twelve with pitch black hair and a white streak in.

His red robe is covered in blood and what appears to be chunks of meat, evidently from the numerous animals he's wearing around his neck.

You open your eyes and feel them get hit by the water "Aagh!

Oh dear" your cousin mutters, looking at your mom "This one is small, I need to push him harder than the other ones if I want him to be able to finish in his clothes"
"No!
Oh joy" you hear your cousin whisper to herself, you open one eye to see her patting her own belly "I thought I hid it well, how cute

"
You don't really think you should, but you aren't really sure of anything when it comes to these two "R-right
You get nervous, but as you have been warned, you try to keep your eyes on her chest "Please" she whispers and then dives under again.
You can't wait any longer, so you try to look down her top, but once again you only manage to see the bottom of her neck and a bit of her shoulder as she moves away from you again
you try to ask, but you find your mouth isn't working and you find yourself completely immersed in the water "I'm..."
you start to panic, but then you stop and close your eyes again "I'm not dying, that is not happening" you try to think happy thoughts to calm yourself down.

You could at least warn him before you have him cutting"
You look at Lisa and she gives you a knowing nod "She is talking about hsving him eyeing your gorgeous body"
"Shut up
" your mom replies "I think it's time for him to see that wonde

"
"You know" your cousin says to you "I think you should cut yourself, you look very vewwy phewwy"

... oh wait, you were in his head, you know what you did"
Your mother leaves and you are left with your cousin.

, but I imagine he might have been given how hard his heart is beating. It's like this with most demons, they can get you with their eyes alone"
If only your mom knew...

, but he is about to go soon" your mom confirms and kisses you on the cheek before leaving again.
As soon as she is gone, Lisa sits next to you on the bench "

want you to hug him"
She gives you a look "Of course we can hug, but you are also aware that fathers don't always let their sons do that right?
You better hold him down" your mom says and leaves you again.

I think the towel is strangling him, get him out of it" your mom shouts.
You blush harder as you try to get out of the towel that is wrapped around you like a burrito "

I don't know what you mean" you lie.
"He is a lot more warm then he should be, and I'm not talking about the water temperature, you know what I mean"
"Lies!

I told you, he's a teenager, what can he do?" your mom answers your cousin's question with the same one "Besides, the boy is in love with Lisa"
Your cousin laughs "
Probably not" your cousin says and laughs "
Well then I have to convince him, you go do your job
Might be time to get him a suppressant, I think I have one that can help him"

Nothing!" you squeak and hope she doesn't hear the lie "We were just talking"
It is true, but you can't let Lisa know.

I will admit, she is pretty and I can see where he would find her attractive"
"Ah! But that doesn't happen with you, right?"
Your mom nods and starts slicing up the bowl "

, I was wondering how we could start..."
Your mom cuts her self in the wrist and holds it out "You take him, I'll watch"
Your cousin smiles at you "

, I was going to tell you about Lisa, but I didn't want to bother you at your job, but since you are here..."
"Lisa, go cut yourself, and hurry up" your mom says "
Your cousin grabs the bowl and pours some of the clots into her hand and puts her hand on your knee to offer it to you "Come on, give it a try, it'll help ease the pain"

title: You Can (Not) Repopulate
description:
There are only two humans left on earth you and your big sis.
And she feels the need to save the human race.
Duty calls...
But oh, she has many a secrets, the saucy little minx.

---------------------

I was trying to get another kind of story, but I guess this is alright.
authorsNote: Erotic writing style set in the post apocalypse. Your sister Talia is madly in love with you. You are reluctant to return Talia’s affection.

actions.text:
The war is over... because everyone is dead. You are pretty sure you and your big sis Tania are the only people left alive. You have no idea how on earth you two survived, but you are grateful. You and her spend your days foraging for food, hunting deer and planting whatever is able to survive this toxic wasteland.

Today though, something seems to be on Tania's mind. She seems distracted and almost fell into a toxic waste pit, twice. You finally man up the courage to confront Tania and her enormous bulk to find out what is wrong.
"Uhh Tania?" You ask as you are searching the nearby forest for some food.
"What is it Jericho?" Tania responds.
"What is with you today? You seem distracted." You say.
"Hmmmm?" She trails off before turning around to face you. "I have just been thinking...we are probably the last people on the planet right? She asks and you nod.
"Well... how is the human race going to continue then? I feel like we owe it to our past generations, and possible future ones, to repopulate the planet..." She trails off a second time, seemingly wanting to look anywhere but you.
"Tania... what are you saying?" You ask, half scared at what she is saying and slightly aroused.
"Look, it's not like I like you or anything I just feel responsible. Can we... can we...?" She trails of, again.

You contemplate all this for a second. You don't really want to do anything with her, but you care for her and don't want her to get herself killed with this spacing out all the time. So, with great reluctance, you say
"If you really feel that strongly about it I guess we can, well, you know." But as soon as you have said that, her lips are on yours. Shocked, you pull away a bit, but Tania isn't having any of that and just trips you. You land hard on your back, leaves crunching as you land and Tania's massive form lands on yours. She pushes you down and straddles you, her lips hungrily devouring yours.
"

Talia, what the hell?! We can't do this!" You yell as you push her off of you.
"Why not? Haven't you ever wanted to catch me before?

I know you do. I've seen you looking at me when we're alone."
"Talia, I'm your sister!"
"Our bond is so much stronger than simple blood relation.

Don't you want to be wild and free for once in your life?"
"Yes! Yes I do, but this isn't a good time for that."

"I'm starting to think it might be, if you keep looking out for me like this."
"Talia! I don't want to talk about this right now!" You yell back.
"Whatever, but if you ever want to do that with me again, you know where to find me!" Talia exclaims and with those last words she begins walking in the direction from where you came.
You lay on the ground thinking about everything that just happened. Is Talia right? Are you really attracted to her?
Well either way, you need to do something about it, but what?

You come up with the most pathetic idea ever.
You run after Talia, and interrupt her as she is hunting,
"Talia!"

"Huh?" She answers, never looking more dangerous than right now.
"I think I'm gay." You say.
"..." This statement causes Talia to freeze for a second before bursting into laughter.

"What?" You ask, a bit confused.
"I can't believe you just said that!"
"Told me what?"
"You just said you think you're gay."
> You say "I don't think that's the main issue here, but I don't mind."

"Ohh, you're actually admitting it?" Talia says, getting over her laughter.
"Well, I wasn't before, but if this is going to help us out of this..."

"That's another reason why you're a bad liar. Not even Dad can lie to Mom about the most banal things and not have it affect the relationship."
"Well, it's the truth!"

"I don't care if it is or isn't, the point remains that you've just said something that you obviously didn't mean."
"I did..."

"And that's a tell all. You were lying."
You just sigh and sit down.

"You're right, I've avoided Talia for a long time, but I can't do this anymore. I need to tell her how I feel."
"No you don't," Talia counters.

"Yes, I do. You're right about me not being able to lie though, but I'm going to try."
You take a deep breath and gather all your courage.

"Talia, I think I'm in love with you."
Talia's expression does a complete one-eighty.

It goes from being annoyed, to being curious then to being shocked and finally to being happy.
"Really? You didn't before," she says.
"Well I wasn't sure. I mean we haven't exactly had many occasions to be together when we're not busy. But I'm pretty sure it's true now, we're talking about it."

"I feel the same way," she says shyly and kisses you briefly on the cheek.
"But I don't want us to do anything rash, lest we mess up what we've got going on."

"I know what you mean. I know this might sound silly, but I was actually hoping that we'd be married someday."
"Married? Why?"
"Well, because then if we got too busy or something, it wouldn't matter. We'd still be married and could still be together."
"Oh, I see what you mean. Yeah, I suppose that would make things a little bit easier to handle. So, who came up with that idea?"

"Oh I don't know, I think it was Makana or something."
"Makana? The panda girl?"
"Yeah, I guess so."
You start laughing.
> You say "Panda girl, huh?"

"Seriously?" you say.
"Yeah, seriously," Talia says.
"Well, I suppose it could be worse. She isn't a nanny as far as I know."

"Who's the father?"
"Well, that I don't know. It could be Coleman."
"You think?"

"Yeah, don't you?"
"I mean I don't have any proof, and he doesn't exactly come off as the type..."

"You don't have to say it."
"Say what?"
"You don't have to say you're in love with me, I can see it in your eyes and written all over your face."

"Wow, thanks."
"No, I really mean it. You really do have the most loving eyes."
"Yeah, well they could also be misleading and I could really hate your guts."
"Probably still love you, no matter what," Talia says and kisses you on the cheek again.

"Yeah, yeah, I know. Let's not pursue this any further, it's making me feel weird," you say.
"Alright, I'll stop."

Just as you're about to put your arms around Talia, someone else grabs Talia through the window.
"What the hell!?" you say as you pull your hands back a little.

"Oh, that's just Zamed," Talia says.
You stand back as Zamed climbs in the window and brushes himself off.
"What are you doing here?"

Talia asks.
"I had to talk to you. Is this a bad time?" Zamed says.
> You say "I'm not even going to take the truble to include you in my remember pin"

"Is now a bad time?" you ask back.
"No, I was just asking."
Zamed looks around before speaking again.

"Are you alone?" he asks.
"Yeah, what difference does that make?"
> You say "Well, actually: NO, I'm not alone" and glance at your sister.

"Oh, okay," Zamed replies.
Talia gives you a glance at first, then looks back at Zamed.
"Why do you ask?" she asks.

"Because we may have a potential ally, but we have to be sure before we can count on them," Zamed says.
"Ally? Against who?"
"The Zealots of course."

"What, are we the main enemies now?"
"No, they are. But if we can take out a few of them, it'll make us look better and hopefully they'll stop attacking us on sight."

"So who are our allies?" you ask.
"Another group, called the 'Guides'."
"You kidding me?"

"No, I'm serious. They are believers of your god, if my information is correct. It's led to a few conflicts with the Zealots..."
"Wait, they call themselves that because they…?"

"Yeah, they're a bunch of wannabe's. But if we can get rid of the Zealots, then we can negotiate with the Guide leaders."
"Negotiate? What for?"
> You say "To get their help, I guess."

"No, we can't afford to do business with them. They'll want something for help and that something is our allegiance. We're not the 'Saints', we're the Guiding Hand."
"But..."
> You facepalm as you keep noticing more and more characters and story that you don't give a damm about and say "I have a better idea" and pierce Zamed's skull with your bare hand while smiling.

"Sorry Zamed, but I'm not going to help you... and I don't care if the rest of your group is."
Zamed's eyes widen as you move closer to him.
"No. I'm not doing what you want, when you want it. I'm going to help my sister, and I'm going to do it my way."

Zamed seems surprised that you're not backing down.
"I'm not going to be told what to do, especially by a stranger."
You

now stand opposite of Zamed, with your sister watching from the side.
"So, you ready to be killed?" you ask.

"No. But if you're not going to help, then I'm going back."
"Fine," you say. "Turn around."
Zamed does so.

"Now, slowly put your hands on the sides of your head and bow your head… good."
You draw out a dagger and stab it into Zamed's skull.
He lets out a yell and falls backwards, smacking his head into the dirt. You kneel down beside him.

"You killed him," Talia says.
"Yeah, and it felt good."
Zamed groans in pain as you turn him over.

He opens his eyes and looks up at you.
"What do you want from me?" he asks.
> You leave with your sister to a random temple.

"Fine," you say. "We can go to a temple."
"Thank God," Talia says. "This way, at least we'll be safe."
"I'm not so sure about that," Zamed says, blood running out of his left ear. "They'll kill us for sure."
> You say "Zamed please disappear already, you are wasting memory space"

"Fine," Zamed says. "I'm going."
Zamed disappears, and you stand up.
"We should go to the temple now, before it's too late."

"I guess so," Talia says.
You walk along the dirt road, and then enter the woods. You walk for ten minutes, before you come across the temple.

It's very large, made from wood, with a thatched roof. There's a wooden sign hanging over the entrance, which has been carved with great care.
"The Temple of the Dragon God" it reads.
> You say "Ha ha HA, we have dragons!"

You burst into laughter as you imagine the inhabitants of this temple running around, trying to tame dragons. You continue to laugh.
"What's so funny?" Talia asks.

"Dragons," you say. "Imagine this lot trying to tame dragons."
"It's not that unlikely," Talia says. "You just have to keep calm, and training them is very difficult."

"Difficult? It'd be impossible. So impossible, that it'd be laughable."
You take off your pack, and begin taking out spare wood.

You begin to fix up the temple. Talia looks on, before walking forward to help you.
"What are you doing?" she asks.
"I'm fixing up the temple."
"Can't we just re-settle somewhere else?" Talia asks. "I mean, this area is dangerous. There's bandits on the roads, and wild animals in the woods."

"Well, what do you want to do?" you ask. "I thought you liked the temple."
"I suppose," Talia says. "But, we really shouldn't stay here for long."

You go back to working on the temple, while Talia sighs and walks away from you. Soon, she lies down in the nearest patch of grass.
"Are you sleeping?" you ask.

"Yeah," she says, not opening her eyes.
You lie down next to her and stare at the clouds in the sky.
"You know we're probably putting ourselves in danger by staying here, right?"

"I know," she says. "But it's nice here, just the two of us."
You stare at the grass for a second, before you lean over and peck her on the lips.

"What was that for?" she asks.
"Nothing," you say. "Just decided to do it again."
You smile, and continue working on the temple.
It takes around three hours, but you finish. You look up at the sky to see the sun setting.
"We should go back," you say. "It's getting dark."
"Mmmm," Talia says. "Actually, I can't walk back. I feel really tired."

"Come on, Talia," you say. "Get up."
"I can't," she says.
You stand up, and offer her a hand.

She stands, and you lead her inside the temple.
"What's your hurry?" she asks.

"It's getting dark," you say. "We should find a place to sleep."
You lead her to the sleeping area.

The bed is still there, though it's covered in grime and looking very rusted. You walk over to it and stare at it.
"Well?" Talia asks.

"Do you like it or something?"
You shrug, and begin to lift the massive, rotting bed up. It almost falls apart, but you manage to keep it together enough to carry it out of the temple.

You notice Talia is staring at the ground.
"What?" you ask.
"The bed," she says. "It needs to be repaired."
"I don't have the equipment to fix it," you admit. "But maybe you could weave a rope out of natural materials. Or..."
> You say "Or we could sleep on the floor, like civilized people"
You walk down to the river and fill your canteen. When you come back, you see Talia sitting on the floor of the temple, her knees drawn up and her arms wrapped around them.

She looks up at you and smiles.
"Here," she says, holding out a small rag. "I cleaned the floor as best I could with water. You can lay down on it."
You glance at the filthy floor. It'll be a pain in the ar..

"Fine," you say. "Thanks."
You lay down on the temple floor. You watch as Talia unwraps the cloth she was holding.

"Here," she says. "Put this under you."
You open your mouth slightly, as if to speak.
"Is something wrong?" she asks.

"Did I do something wrong?"
"No," you say. "Everything's fine."
You watch as she lifts her nightgown up and smiles at you.
> You say "No homo"

"Don't worry," she says. "I'm not going to.."
"No! I.."
You stare at her as she looks at you in confusion.

"I won't do anything to you," you say.
You look away as she begins to lift her nightgown up, revealing her body.

She smiles as she lowers herself to you.
You regain your awareness a split second before she pushes you down.

You feel her lips on your own. Her tongue enters your mouth, and you wrap your arms around her, holding on for dear life.
You slowly come to your senses.
You're lying on the floor, staring at your sister, who's staring back at you.

You grab her, and pull her onto your lap. You stare into her eyes, smiling.
"I love you," you say.
She smiles as she begins to grind her body against yours.
> You say "I wonder what you meant with that "Don't worry, I'm not going to..."

She smiles as she begins to grind her body against yours.
"Do you want to know what I was going to say?" she asks.
You nod.

"No homo," she says.
You stare at her in confusion, and she bursts out laughing.
"What? Is that bad?" you ask.
She shakes her head.
> You say "Making that joke was a mistake XD"

She laughs as she stands, wrapping her arms around your neck.
"I love you," she says.
She hops up and kisses you on the lips.

You hold her tightly for several seconds before she hops out of your grasp.
"I have to go to sleep," she says.
She walks over to her bedding in the corner and curls up, closing her eyes. You stare at her for several seconds, before walking to your own bedding in the corner.

You curl up, falling asleep with a smile on your face.
You awake to the sunlight shining through the windows. You stretch, standing.
You notice fresh meat on a spit, which the religious fanatics brought in while you were asleep. You walk over to the fire, and start eating, before wrapping up the meat and putting it in your bag.
You look around, spotting four men carrying in a body on a table. One of the men stares at you, before blowing into a tube and taking out a dart.
He aims for your neck, before you grab his throat. You feel his life force drain from him as he gurgles and falls silent.
> You say "Hewwo, what awe you guys doing here?"

You stare at them, two holding the body on the table, another holding a strange device with a long barrel, and the last holding up a bizarre rifle with a human skull for a stock and a curved blade on the front

. The man stares at you, grinning.
"We came to... to try to make a deal," you say.
"A deal?" he asks.
"My sister and I are wanderers. We have the means to offer you. We want to be sure to come to an agreement with you before we enter your camp."
"Glad to meet some sense into this crowd," he says. "What can you offer us?"

undoneWindow.text:
He ignores your presence as he sharpens a stone, intent on his work. You grab one of the men and twist his arm behind his back, forcing him to the floor.
"What are you doing?"

the man asks.
"I'm asking what you lot are doing here," you ask.
"We're taking care of a loose end," he says.

You stare at the men, who quickly aim their weapons at you.
"I'm saying, what are you doing here?" you ask.
"We found her wandering in the woods," one of the men says.

The men stare at you as the one who spoke earlier holds up a tablet, showing a picture of you.
"We're here to check if anyone has seen this man around, he's gone missing," he says.
You walk over to the table. Two of them are cutting flesh from the corpse. The fourth man holds a small knife, carefully cutting up the flesh.
You grab the dart from your neck, as the men stare at you, one holding a blowpipe with a dart aimed at you.

"You, sir, are walking death," he says.
You stare at him, and he drops the blowpipe. You grab it, pointing it at him as he backs away.
> You say "What exactly were you NOT going to do?"

"I said don't worry," she says. "I'm not going to.."
"No, I mean...."
"I was going to have relations with you?" she asks.
You blush furiously.

"Erm.."
"You're embarrassed," she says. "That's fine. I understand."
She pushes you away and gets off of you. You watch as she goes over to her cloth.

"I was not going to do anything to you," Talia says, showing you a toothy smile.
"What?" you say.
"I was not going to have desciples."
"What?"

"You're not a hermaphrodite are you?" you ask, raising an eyebrow.
"What? No!" Talia says, looking away. "I just... doesn't it bother you?"

You say, "No, I'm not gay."
"Oh," she says.
"I'm just saying that I'm not into girls," you say. "But thanks for the offer."
"Oh."

"No homo," you say.
Talia frowns.
"What?" she asks.
"Nothing."
You watch as Talia gets up and leaves the room.

You feel your face go red as you think of Stewart. You tell yourself you are just having pre-historic homo thoughts, but that doesn't help.
"Scoot over," Talia says.

"Do you want to see something?" she asks.
She spreads her legs, and you stare into her brown body. It's not like the women you've known back in Teckleville.

You stare at her face, but your eyes begin to close on their own accord. You feel yourself falling into unconsciousness.
"Good night, Jacob," she says, as you drift off to sleep.

She begins to lower herself down, lowering herself on you slowly.
"Ah," she says. "This feels sooo good."
Time passes. You try to remain conscious.

"How do you know how to do all this?" you ask.
"I've read a little bit about the subject," she says. "I used to daydream about things like this sometimes."

"Good night, brother," she says, as you drift off to sleep.
The next morning, you wake up to Talia shaking you.
"Wake up," she says.

You see beds, a spinning wheel and an area for nursing babies. You look around, but there's nowhere to sleep.
"We'll have to make do," you say. "Lay down."
"Where?"
"And that's the point. We settle in a dangerous place, we are more likely to remain safe. Besides, it's part of the reason why people join the order. They have to put up with hardship."
> You say "Eh?"

"I want to make it a place of worship," Talia says.
"Why?"
"We need it."
"So do we need to save the wood for a house?"

"No," Talia says. "We can save the wood for a temple."
"A temple?"
"Yes, a temple."
"Instead of a house?"
"Yes," Talia says.
> You say "I mean I get your point, but to worship who exactly?"

"The dragon deity."
"Oh," you say. "What's this deity's name?"
"Mazkil."
"Who's that?"
"I dunno. A dragon deity."

"Let's go inside," you say.
The pair of you walk into the temple, and are hit by a blast of hot air.

"W-what are you doing?! he asks.
"It's over."
"You can't…

"Come on, get up. We should go."
Zamed groans in pain, before slowly getting up. You help him back onto the horses.
You look at your sister, who nods at you. You and your sister ride back to Senet. You get off the horses once you see the gates opening. A few people wave at you.

"You lead, I'll follow," you say.
"Ha-ha! I like your kind! So pragmatic!" Zamed laughs as he gets onto his horse. "Where are we going?"
> You say "ZAMED?"

"What?"
"How do we know that the Zealots aren't going to just wipe us out anyway? How do we know your group is any less dangerous than the 'Saints'?"

"We're not going to kill him, we're going to dictate a trade agreement," Talia says.
You smirk at her attempt to be 'helpful'.

grin.
"That's good. You should stand up for yourself."
You raise your hand and slap him in the face, leaving your hand there so he knows the damage it can do.

"Ah, but stranger than fiction, is true." You say.
And with those words you grab Zamed's hand and place it on top of Talia's head.

"Oh yeah? Well you can come with me right now if you want, I'm sure your group will be happy to hear that their contact isn't following orders."
Talia looks at you, worried.
"But the temple is almost complete, won't they just rebuild it stronger?"

"No, not at all," Talia says. "I'm just with my brother, talk to you later, Zamed."
Zamed blushes a little and gives you a dirty look before walking away.

I thought you didn't like me." You say weakly, as her hands dig into your shirt.
"I don't...

See? Seemed like a good idea at the time." You say.
"Oh shut up and stop puling!
lifts it up, discarding it, before grabbing the waistband of your pants and pulling them down.
pulls it up and over your head, as she uses one hand to grip your hair and the other to fondle one of your firm
, yet still nubile, bosoms. You're completely at her mercy and she takes full advantage of that.
You're not sure how long this was going on for, but you know it had to have been a long time since anyone has actively pursued you like this.
Maybe it's just your outgoing nature and your years of surviving alone, but you're not going to deny yourself this experience.
You return the favor and tug off her leggings and panties in record time, and then thrust your fingers into her dripping snatch.
It's sopping and smooth to the touch, and while you've had a few beautiful women in your life, none of them really compare to the tightness and warmth of a well used stadium toilet.
Even Lisa, your last girlfriend was just pleading with you to give her an answer about having children.

title: Eiyuu Senki: The World Conquest
description:
Based on a game of the same name.

Get isekai'd to a world where all the famous historical characters are female.
The story starts during a coup d' etat attempt by rebels of one of Japan fractions.
memory: [You are Ricky a male neet that died and was summoned by Himiko to this world.][You wear a leather armor.][You wield a katana.][ Japan status: <civil war>][Yamatai status: <War(Kyoto& Edo)>][World period: <Renaissance& 16XX>][ You status: Preparing Yamatai's army for conquest& Convincing Nobunaga to help you to attack Kyoto.][Nobunaga prouposed an alliance thorought a political marriage.][Kyoto's ruler refused to surrenddr.][ Takeru commands Yamatai's forces.][ You army: <Himiko& Takeru& Seimei/ Nobunaga>][Yoshitsune is in Kyoto][Oda Nobunaga is in Edo]

actions.text:
You suddenly wake up, the last you remember is the searing light or a car, followed by a sharp pain on your side. After that there was just silence... until now.
"Oh, thanks heavens you are awake" a voice says "We need your help to contain the rebels"
"What?" you ask confusesd "Who are you?"
"I'm Himiko, Yamatai's rul...THAT'S NOT IMPORTANT, THE REBELS ARE UPON US, WE NEED TO ACT NOW" she says with tears on her eyes.
Not sure of what is going on, you follow her outside the castle and there you see the problem: There is a huge battle, it seems like the rebels are pushing the what you think are Himiko's troops back. Also, you spot a purple haired girl giving them orders.

"DON'T LET THEM PASS, we can't afford to lose the castle" the purple haired girl (who must be the general) says imperative.
You rush into the battle, with Himiko behind you
, though still crying. Right now your field is a hill, which you must take to have any terrain advantage.

> You say "Oh, ok I here to meet with Kyoto and Edo's leaders. I see Nobunaga is already here, but I don't see the other"
"Yes, she's been talking with the northeastern leader for quite a while now. I believe they are both waiting for the last guest to arrive."
"Wait, what? Are you telling me the other guest is the last to be announced... the ruler of Rask?"
The guard gives you a look of disbelief with a raise of an eyebrow.
"Alright, thank you"
You enter the room. The room is large and ornate with paintings covering the wall. A large group stands near the room's only table.
"There you are, I was starting to worry!" Nobunaga exclaims.
Everyone turns and obeys her order. You're one of the few who doesn't, instead walking towards her younger brother.
"Who are you?" She asks.
"Ricky, I'm here to meet the leaders of the three major governments in this area."
"Yes, I know, but why are you here?"
"I'm not sure I understand."
"Why do you need to meet with the governments?"

> You look at Himiko, looking for an answer.
You see the girl who looks to be about your age. She short brown hair with bangs, brown eyes, and a slim but not too thin frame. She's wearing a black kimono with orange clouds, tied in a very ornate way, which shows off her figure.
"I'm here to talk about peace."
"I see..." Himiko begins thoughtfully, clearly planning out her next words. "Well, I suppose that is a good goal. There has been too much fighting recently. Too many have been hurt, some killed, on both sides. That cannot continue.
There is a brief silence.

> You say "Hmm, shouldm't we wait for the third ruler to arrive?"
You realize that Himiko doesn't know much about the other rulers.
"Kyoto and Edo's rulers are busy women, so it's excact timing that is important for the third ruler." Himiko says.
The girl who you assume to be the ruler of Edo speaks up.
"Well, as you might expect, I have very little free time. I can give an answer now, but the truth is, I'll probably be here for another half an hour at least."
"That's not good enough!" Himiko exclaims. "We need an answer now!"
"It's all I can give you," the girl says, her voice becoming irritated.

> You say "Ok, lets begin."
"Alright, then let's begin. What is it that you want to discuss?"
Himiko explains the situation. The girl listens intently.
"I see... this isn't good. I'd rather not get involved, but my duty is clear. I'll try to give you an answer as soon as possible."
"What do you need?"

> You say "I was thinking on the possibility of Japan's unification"
"Yes, that is a fairly popular goal in the country. A lot of people would love to see that happen. I don't see why it can't, either."
"There are several obstacles in the way of such a thing."
"I've heard. Can you discuss some of them?"
"The biggest is the home of the monkey, the Dai-Nippon Republic."
"Can't we just kill them all? I mean, that's what we're here for right?" Himiko says.

> You wheeze after hearing Himiko's answer, not expecting that from her.
"No. There are about thirty eight thousand men under arms there and another thirty thousand stationed at various other islands. If we just tried an attack, we would lose a lot of men."
"But we have to do something." Himiko says.

> You look at Edo's ruler and ask her what does she prouposes.
"I don't understand. What are you proposing? That we just unite with them under some mutual banner or something?"
"Err, yes actually."
After a brief pause, the girl continues.
"That's... not a bad idea, despite what my homeland would like to think. I believe an alliance between us would be beneficial and I will explain why I say that."
She goes on to explain that the main threat to the two nations is not necessarily other countries, but each other.
The long and the short of it is, is that she doesn't want to fight you or anyone else. She just wants peace between the two of you and is willing to go along with most ideas that can achieve this.

"So... do you have anything else in mind?"
She thinks for a moment and then comes up with another idea.
"How about we make an alliance of a different kind?"

She says.
Now THAT sounds a lot more interesting.

"Go on." You say.

"Well, let's just say that I'm not opposed to your advances toward me... in that way."
Now THAT is a surprise. You didn't expect the girl to be so forward.

This is going to require a little more explanation on her part.
"I'm sorry, what?" You ask, a bit confused.

"You heard me."
"I think you're misunderstanding something. I'm a bit old for you..."

"Oh please. I'm not talking about your wizidic nature. I mean in the physical aspect. I know you want me."
"Wait... REALLY?"

"Hell yeah. I mean I can tell you want me bad. I can even tell you want me more than you want Himiko."
And with those words, Himiko gets jealous and strikes you.
"Don't You Dare. You don't want her; you just want her body." Himiko says, hitting you again.
"H-Hey!" You say, trying to defend yourself from the relentless pummeling.
> You say "Why are you hitting me?? I didn't do anything, besides this is just political stuff."
"Oh please. You don't need to pretend with me. I know you want my body and Himiko's

just doesn't do it for you."
"What are you even talking about? Do you want some kind of revenge or something?"
"Me? No, I'm just playing.
> You say "THIS IS SERIOUS"

"What?"
"You're playing some sort of game and I'm not in on it. We could've been doing this without all these underhanded attempts at seduction, don't you think?"
Now it's Himiko's turn to pause. You fairly certain you just threatened to have relations with the girl, but who knows...maybe it worked.
"I-I don't know what to say. Well, I suppose my question is why do you want to be enemies with the Oda?" Himiko says.

"I don't."
"Liar!"
"Seriously, I don't. I came here out of expedient sake."
"Err..."
> You say "Lets get to the point, what are we going to do"

"Well, despite my threats, I'm not here to have you and your boyfriend's bodies. I just want an alliance."
"What?!!"
> You say "And you are prouposing a political marriage, right?"

"Well, that would be one way of putting it." she says.
"WHAT??!" Himiko says startled.
"Explanations later. Can we just make an alliance before the Kyoto's ruler arrives?"

"Well...okay." Himiko says, a bit meek.
"Good, now how about we make this meeting of ours public so none of our other enemies can take advantage of us?"

"Right."
The two of you leave the temple and Himiko takes of to inform her forces of the meeting between all the major leaders.
You decide to take some of your own people to the destination while Himiko is informing her army. You have a feeling that you're going to be attacked by someone, so you get your archers ready.

You take a few dozen people with you and you arrive at the palace.
You see a bunch of men in cloaks milling about, most of them with helmets on.

You also see a few women there as well. You wonder who these people are.
"So, who are all these guys?" You ask Himiko as she goes up to some of them to speak.
"Oh, those are the Shinsengumi. Shinsengumi? That's a weird name." Himiko says to you in a semi-joking manner.

"You don't like the name?" one of them says to you.
"No, I suppose it's just strange." You say.
"You don't seem like the type to like weird."
> You look at them.
You look at them closer and you notice something. Most of the members seem to be younger than you, though certainly not quite on the level of being teenagers.
They all wear the same helmet and different colored cloaks.

The helmet has a visored pattern like the ones knights of olden times would wear. Strangely enough, all of the members are female.
"

Are all of you Shinsengumi?" You ask.
"Yes."
"All of your members are female?"
"Are you really a police organization?"

"Yes."
"Then why are there so few men?"
"...I'll answer your questions later. Do you have anyone near Edo who can find me a suitable place to sleep tonight?"

"I think we can..."
Before your question can be answered, Himiko comes back to you and says that she has found a place where you can stay. It's a police barracks that is currently unattended.

You're to take up residence in there.
"Himiko, where did you find a place that's unattended?"
"It's a long story..."
Well whatever.
You don't really care right now. You just want to get some rest.
> You go to the police's barrack Himiko suggested.
You decide to go with Himiko's idea. If she feels comfortable enough to stay in a police barracks, then it can't hurt to do the same. Plus it'll probably be better than sleeping in the streets.
You tell your group to wait outside and you go in. When you get inside, you see that the place is a little more furnished than you thought it would be, with several nice pieces of furniture.
You also see several men lying on the floor in various states of inebriation. One man however is standing talking to a few of them and he looks over at you.
"Oh it's the new boy, come to ruin our fun eh? Well if you want to get in the ring, let's go." He says challenging you to a drinking contest.

Normally this wouldn't be something you'd really jump at, but you're so desperate for sleep right now that you'll do anything.
"Sure I'll beat your little eastside drinking record out of you."

You say.
"Ha! You think you can just walk in here and take one of our records? I bet you're not from round here is you are." The man says.

"I'm not, but I need sleep and I've had a long day so you're going to have to beat me too many times than you thought was possible."
"Hm, I'll drink then."

The man says and downing his own glass.
"I'll get you up to drinking me as many times as I can beat, because I'm not going to be around that many times."
> You take a drink, and then another and another...
You down three shots quickly and then begin to feel the effects. You're not drunk yet, but you soon will be. Your waist is feeling a little tight, but you're enjoying the hell out of this.

You decide to take another shot, and nearly choke on the horrible tasting liquid when you swallow it.
"Wow, that really kicked in fast." You say.
"Yeah, I told you he only had one or two shots, let's go get some more." One of the men says and gets up to leave.

"Well that was an interesting way of gaining alcohol wasn't it." The man you were drinking against says.
You stand up, but sway a bit.

"Alright it's getting late, I think it's time for all of us to be heading off to bed."
You stumble out of the bar and up to your room.
> You realize you forgot about Himiko.

You wake up and realize that Himiko is probably still at the bar.
"Himiko?" You call to her.
No reply.
You get up and walk outside.

On your way to the bar you pass a man standing there.
"Hey you're that guy that was with Himiko right?" The man asks.
"Yeah?" You reply somewhat wary of this situation.

"She's been looking for you, she said you had to come back to the bar."
You exhale a breath that you didn't know you were holding.
"Thanks."

You say and walk into the bar.
You walk up to the bar and see Himiko sitting there quietly.
"Hey Himi, I'm back." You say walking up to her.

"Oh... I'm glad you're back. I was wondering where you went." Himi says getting up slowly.
You sit down next to her and are immediately hugged.
"I'm so sorry I left like that. I didn't think you were coming back." Himi says into your chest.
> You say "Should be head back to Yamatai? We have been in Edo long enough"

"Yeah, let's go back to the island."
The two of you walk through the streets to the nearest ship. You never managed to buy a ship here, Himiko paid for it all.

You can imagine how much that cost. You don't care though. You've made enough money.
The two of you get on the ship and Himiko immediately goes to her room.
You on the other hand choose to go to the crow's nest and take in the sights of the water. You spend most of your time up there, Himiko comes up occasionally and talks but you mostly enjoy the quiet.
Eventually the two of you arrive back on the island. Himiko rushes to her room. You think you've annoyed her a bit by lingering around.
You aren't sure why, you've always been nice to her. Perhaps it's the fact that she had to pay for everything that bothered her. Still, you're not helping with paying for anything anymore.
> You head back to the palace with her.

You find Himiko sitting by herself in the grass watching the wind blow the many petals of the nearby flowers.
"I wanted to surprise you." Himiko says when she sees you."Come here often?"

"Not really, but I like to look at them when I can."
"Do you ever think about future?" Himiko asks.
"Like what?" You ask.
"Like...do you have partner? Kids? Do you live happily ever after?" Himiko asks.
"I actually never thought about it much. I mean I get by just fine, but then I've always been a bit of an adventurer at heart."

"I don't want you to get too settled. You should travel and see other places."
"Well I suppose I know the next best thing to seeing new places...going on an adventure."

"How about I accompany you on your next voyage?"
"Sure I'd love that."
"Great! I'll go pack!"
You spend next few days preparing for your trip.

"I want you to go with me to Nuro." Himiko says.
"What? To the land of the dead?"
"Yes."
"That sounds really boring."
> You say "Well, we have yet to unify Japan"

"Yeah...well we'll get there eventually." Himiko says and stands up. "Come on, we should get back to the palace. They might start wondering where we are."
"Who?"

"Everyone. Let's walk."
The two of you walk back to the palace arm in arm. It's one of the few times you've ever seen Himiko show physical affection towards you.

You're a bit moved by it.
Once back Himiko becomes more like her usual self...but still less than she was before.

"You're looking a little better. Not much, but a little." You say.
"I'm fine. I just have a lot on my mind. Let's get to work!"
The first couple of days back are a little awkward between the two of you, but eventually you get back to work as usual.
Himiko does tell you that she still would like to go to Nuro. You explain that it's probably a bad idea since it'll stir up more anger from the city-states in that region.
You also explain that You could possibly unite the other six cities through an agreement of some sort, but you'd have to be there with a large sized army to ensure that the deal is kept.

"So...it's a good idea or a bad idea?" Himiko asks.
"It's a good idea, but we probably shouldn't go."
"Why not?"

"Well we'd have to go as head of a huge army, and I don't think the both of us would come back."
"Oh."
The two of you don't really talk much more after that.
Week passes into month, Month passes into year and still Himiko doesn't show any signs of wanting to go to Nuro. During this time you go back and forth with your duties as a daimyo.
> You say "Meh, so what are we going to do... do we have any news from Nobunaga?"

Not long after you and Himiko finished your conversation, a messenger comes running up to your throne.
"My liege, a letter has arrived for you from..." He pauses to catch his breath.

"From Nobunaga."
You both sit up straight.
The letter is written in Japanese, but the messenger speaks in common which allows you to read it.

It's fairly short and to the point.
Things have been going well for me. I shall keep them that way I trust you are doing the same, my liege.

I have thought about our conversation.
I still think that it would be in our best interest to unite our forces.
I would be honored if you would accompany me to meet with the other Daimyo of the lands when the rains let up. I shall send a ship to pick you up.

If you are able to come only you, that would be Grand. If you must bring others, then I shall send my own people to... supervise.
I look forward to seeing you.
F.N.
P.S. I have renamed the city we were going to raid, to the City of the Lost Hero, and now it Shall be known as Edo.

The letter is signed "Oda Nobunaga".
"Well, it's about time he sent someone to pick you up," Himiko says.
> You say "Himiko, remember that Nobunaga is a woman, please."

"Oh yeah, forgot about that."
"I'll just bet you did." Himiko says sarcastically.
You haven't forgotten about it but neither has she.
> You say "Anyway, didn't we passed by Edo a while ago? We should see Kyoto's ruler before we see Nobunaga again, we need to see which are her intentions because she missed last meeting"

"Let's hope their meeting this time will be better" You say.
You're all riding on horseback, back to the capital.

The messenger is ahead of you on a horse, he's a fast one, so the three of you aren't walking your horses.
You have a conversation to fill the time.

"This could be a trap, you should be careful." Himiko says. "The other Daimyo, she's probably been waiting for years for an excuse to kill you."
"Probably you should too."

You say. "Wait, why are you copying me, you hate copying people."
"You do it well, I'll be ashamed if I didn't learn from you." Himiko replies.
> You say "Hmm, so... we are going to the capital, right?"

"Yeah, apparently the Daimyo is looking to make a fresh start and is sick of the war."
"How does the other Daimyo stack up?"

"She's about the same, though she doesn't seem willing to give up his conquest."
"Ah, so the war is going on then."
> You say "But where exactly is the capital, in which region?"

"I dunno, I'm not a map maker."
You really wish you were some kind of artist. The landscape looks very... Generic.
> You say "Well, but there are three powers in Japan, right? One of those are us: Yamatai, ruled by you, but what about the rulers of the other regions?

"The other region is the main religious faction, they're sort of unified under a single leader, but her influence stretches barely more than Kyoto. Then there's the Oda region, ruled by the warring clans."
> You say "So that means we are going to Kyoto, right?"

"Well, that would be the logical choice, but who knows if we are going to be safe there?"
"I think everyone needs a home."

You say.
"You are right of course, but I'm still concerned about the other warlords."
When you arrive, it's in a region that was fairly safe, at least compared to the war.
You see that the messenger sent you here was smart. Word is going to spread that you are here, so you probably should have had some of your troops positioned elsewhere.

Still, you could easily do this.
"Take out the soldiers that are in the surrounding area and grab whatever weapons they have available. Kill them all." You say.
"You got it." Himiko replies.
Himiko is quite the warrior. You fought side by side with her during the war and she has yet to let you down.
When she takes the sword and runs it through a soldier, you can't help but feel proud of her.

Once all the soldiers are dead, she turns to you.
"The Daimyo's palace is that way." She points.

"Lead the way." You say.
You ride your horse up to the palace gates and you and Himiko get off.
"Send in the news." you command.

A man wearing a robe with the kanji for "healer" on the back walks out.
"What is it?" He says.
"I'm the leader of the new government."

"Oh, are you the Leader of the Nation? Well, nice to meet you!"
He shakes your hand and you have no idea why, but some how you don't trust this man.
> You say "I have come here to have a meeting with your leader"

"I will inform the Daimyo!" The man says and runs inside.
You wait for about ten minutes and still no sign of the leader.
"She'll be in soon, I just spoke to her."

The man says.
"Okay then, where is this Daimyo?"
"I can't tell you that, it's a secret!"
"Is there any other way to contact the leader?"

"Other than the Daimyo, I can only tell you that she is young, beautiful, ambitious and very intelligent."
Well, at least the Daimyo sounds promising.

"Can you at least tell me if the Daimyo is a man or a woman?"
"Oh, that would be a feminine name, she is a woman."

"How do you know?"
"The windows are too high to see, but I can tell by looking at the roof that the one leaning against it is a woman."
Well at least you know one thing.

You wait for about an hour and the man finally walks out.
"The Daimyo will see you now."
You follow the man upstairs and down a hall.
You come to a door with the kanji for "Daimyo" on it. You open it and see a very regal looking woman. She has long hair, and her face looks quite young.

"Yes?" She says, looking up from her desk.
"My name is Ricky, I represent Yamatai fraction"
"I'm aware."

"Oh, good, you're knowledgeable"
You think for a second.
"Well Daimyo, I'm here to discuss your future."
"My future?"

"Yes, what will you be doing once this war is over?"
"I will be rebuilding the country."
"What else?"
"I don't know... I will what I'm good at."
> You say "When the war ends? Aren't you being too positive?"

"It won't end soon, if it ever. The losing side is going to want to keep fighting to the bitter end."
"So you're saying there is no chance of a treaty?"
> You say "Well, there is a chance if a treaty, but I don't know if you will like it"
"A chance... well I suppose that is better than no chance, what is it you want?"

You think for a moment.
"A surrender?"
She laughs.
"What makes you think I'd accept?"
"Well I don't know... but if I was in your position, I would"
> You say "Because I have Edo as an ally"

"Oh you do? What is this place?"
You explain the city to her, and she seems enthused by the information.
"They're an ally? Why aren't we at war?"

"Our rulers have a non-violent agreement that stops the hostilities between our two cities."
"That's strange, because I remember learning about a city by the same name. I thought it was a myth."
"Well it may have been once, but it's reality now. We even have an ambassador there."

"Well this is all very fascinating, but what does this have to do with me?"
"We want you to surrender."
"I don't think I will"
> You say "You are in a very bad position, my lady. Our forces almost double yours, and we count with riflemen on our side"

"We?"
"My ruler and I and a few others"
"You have a ruler? are you a king?"

"I suppose you could say that I am, yes."
"Hmmm... interesting..."
The Daimyo stares at you for a moment, and then speaks.

"Alright. I'll listen to your offer."
You feel a sigh of relief, and almost smile, but stop yourself.
"However," she says,

"my answer is no."
The Daimyo stands up and begins to approach you. You stand your ground, but step back a bit so you're out of her reach.

"My answer is no, but I do want to talk. Will you come back later?"
"I don't think that will be necessary, my answer is the same."
You nod and turn to leave.

"You do know that if you don't surrender in the next week, I'll have to kill all of you, right?"
You turn back around.

"Yes, we know."
The Daimyo smiles a bit.
"Good. See you soon."
She leans forward and touches your chest.

For a moment you think she's going to try something, but instead she just smiles and walks past you. You hear her footsteps as they fade into the distance.
You're alone.
> You go to meet Himiko outside   Kyoto Daimyo's palace.
After meeting with the daimyo, you head outside the palace and wait by the steps. Eventually Himiko approaches, escorted by a few guards. When she sees you she smiles.

"Hello, sweet cheeks." Himiko says, smiling.
"Hello Himiko. Are you okay?"

you reply, smiling.
"Sure, I'm fine. What about you?"
"I guess we both are."
Himiko walks up to you and puts her hand on your chest.

"I'm glad you came back. I really needed to talk to you."

.

I WANT TO FIND ES FOR DIO'S SAKE"
