worldInfo.keys: Misterious woman, your killer, the woman, the demon princess
worldInfo.entry:
The woman who murdered you, you are looking for her, she seems to ramdomly kill people that cross her way, you want to know why she killed you, she seems to like to tease you, every time u find her she fights with you and defeats you with ease(she havent killed you again, yet).
She is like your height, has black hair and grey eyes, she has a dagger and a bow.
It seems like she is a demon princess.

She is the one who saved you from dying in the demon princess hands, but you had to give her your soul, now you are her puppet and you have to do anything she asks(not that you mind), you feel great devotion for her. She likes to verbally abuse you.

actions.text:
Mercenaries and adventurers who enter monster dungeons are always there for the treasures and rewards. Those who enter monster caves, on the other hand, are considered madmen. Caves full of monsters rarely have rewards, and these monsters are much stronger than those you'd find in a dungeon. Despite those qualities, it doesn't deter thrill-seeking adventurers like you...

Your name is Ricky the ThotSlayer, and you are an adventurer in the kingdom of Larion. You enter monster caves not for the goal of treasures, instead looking for action with the deadliest creatures you can find in the kingdom. Right now, you stand before the large entrance of a monster cave. Just by standing there, you can hear the sounds of dangerous wild animals and monsters lurking inside. You take a moment to mentally prepare yourself for what could be your demise, but once you're ready, you grab your cursed dagger and walk in.

Upon entering the monster cave, the first thing you see is
a large cave bear. They are one of the top predators in the cave, and as such are usually first to be found in a cave.
> You say "A worthy oponent"

You say, "I'll face you."
You stand in front of the cave bear, waiting for the attack. It charges at you very quickly, which you easily dodge out of the way.
As it runs, you jump in the air and stab your dagger into the cave bear's back. The bear roars out in pain, but you don't remove the dagger.
The bear turns around and swings his paw at your head. You expect him to miss since he is so close to hitting you, but at the last moment he slips and instead hits his own foot with the swing.
You are able to avoid the bear's grasp with a quick roll to the side.
You continue to stand in the center of the cave as the cave bear gets back up to his feet. He stumbles around in the cave, trying to find a good position from which to strike you down.
> You pull out your bow.
You decide to try your bow. You yank the bow out of its case and notch an arrow in it.
> You shoot at the bears eyes.
You shoot the arrow at the bear's eyes, but miss. You miss it's right eye by a hair. The bear swipes his paw at your head.
> You step back and shoot again.
You shoot the arrow at the bear's left eye, hitting it dead on and lodging the arrow into his eye socket. The bear roars in pain and attempts to pull out the arrow.
> You get to back and keep shooting.
You put another arrow in your bow and shoot as many arrows as you can at the bear. You hit the bear in his stomach, ear, and chest, but it doesn't slow him down.
It does nothing to scare him either, instead he only gets angrier. He runs towards you at full speed and swings his paw.
> You get in his blind spot.
You step to the side and get out of the bear's blind spot, but he quickly turns around and charges into you with his great weight. You fall on the ground as the bear stomps on your chest.
With every ounce of your being, you pull the arrow out of the bear's eye and shove it back into your bow. The bear roars in pain and attempts to pull out the arrow.
> You slice his throat.
You pull out your dagger and plunge it into the bear's neck. You stab downward into his trachea, and the dagger goes through his neck and into the ground.
The bear roars and lifts his paw off of you. You grab your dagger and stab it through his stomach. You stab downward into his intestines as he collapses on top of you.
You push the dagger in as deep as it'll go, and twist it once. A spray of blood goes everywhere.
You pull your dagger out and get off of the beast. You look at the dagger in amazement. It's a beauty.
You walk over to the cave and find a piece of honeycomb. You sit down against a tree and start eating. The honey is sweet, but it doesn't do much for your stomach.
> You make a fire.
You remember that you have a lighter in your pocket. You pull it out and see that it works. The bear must have knocked it out of your hands when it attacked you.

You set the bear on fire and watch as it roasts over a small fire. The smell of flesh cooking is enough to make you gag.
You continue on to the cave's mouth and into the cave.
The cave is dark, but not pitch black. You see a large shape ahead of you. It's another bear. This one is different though.
> You observe the bear.
The bear in front of you looks different. It doesn't move like the others. It doesn't growl or charge at you. It just stares at you.
> You say "Hello?"

You say "Hello."
The bear doesn't move or make a sound.
You step back and draw your bow.
"What are you?"
"Don't shoot!" a voice cries.
You turn around to see a young woman with dark hair cut into a tumbling bun. She is dressed in tan leather armor and boots. She carries a bow on her back and a dagger by her side.

"You!" you say.
"Yes, me," she says.
"You were there."
"I was."
"In my head," you say.
"Very observant of you."
> You observe the woman.

You stare at the woman.
"What are you?"
"I'm a human, same as you."
"No. I mean what are you? You're different than other humans I've seen.

You're not ugly, but you're not pretty either."
The woman stares at you in silence.
"Answer the question."
"I'm not playing this game.

I'm late for battle, goodbye."
The woman cocks her bow and aims it at you.
"I'm sorry I asked then.
> You say "Wha-"
The woman releases an arrow and hits you in the throat. She releases another arrow and hits you in the eye. You pull out the arrows, but blood stains your throat and eye.
> You say "WHY THE FUCK YOU DID THAT FOR??"

You drop to your knees and cough blood out of your throat. The woman steps forward and pushes you in the chest with her boot.
"You're a fool if you expect an answer."

You look up at her in anger.
"I'll remember this."
The woman turns and leaves, leaving you to bleed out.
You've been killed by the hands of an idiot.
> Yo sell your soul to the demon of your dagger to live

forever.
You sell your soul to the demon of your dagger to live forever.
You regret this choice immediately after making it. Demons are known for screwing you over in some way, which happens in your case.

The demon takes your soul and you plummet to the depths of hell.
You're in the bowels of hell, forced to serve the demon lord Velzix.
He wants your soul in exchange for the chance at saving your own life.
> You say "Ok deal"

You make a deal with Velzix and become a mortal again.
Your body heals itself, but you're left with a weak and sickly state.
> You follow the woman who killed you.

The woman walks through the forest until she stops at a castle. She draws a blade and hacks four men to death before being pulled inside the castle.
You're left wondering why she killed the men. Were they innocent?

She didn't leave you with that impression. They were probably bandits who bruised her ego. You suppose you'll never know.
You follow her into the castle, but are grabbed from behind by a half dozen men.
> You say "Err... shouldnt you guys be worried more about thar woman asaulting your castle?"

The men look at you confused.
"No, we were just talking about the woman who came in here and killed four of us before being pulled inside."
The men point to a picture on the wall.
> You say "Oh im following her, want to tag up?"
The men agree and say they'll follow you to the castle.
> You keep folowing the woman with the guys.

You look back and you're lead into a library.
"Alright, now stop looking so afraid. I said stop!" one of the men says. You notice all of them have crossbows on their backs.
You take a deep breath and follow your rescuers. They lead you to the kitchen, then out the back door of the castle, past the moat and into the open air.
> You say "Huh? Im sure she went this way..."
One of the men points to a door in the side of a nearby tower. You nod and open the door, only to be faced with a wall of arrows.
> You gET OUT OF THE DOOR.
You quickly head for where you think the woman went through, when one of the men takes out a bunch of keys and opens the door you came in, then waves you through.

You see the woman in front of you, holding the head of a slain guard.
"Sorry about that. That last one got a little handsy, I thought it was time to get rid of him."
> You say "Listen here you little shit, you cant yust kill me and get away with it"
The woman chuckles.

"I don't think you're going to get away with it, but it doesn't matter. You're already dead."
You realize this is the girl from the woods, then.
"Well, fine. If you're gonna kill me anyway, you could've just done it yourself and saved the trouble of dragging me here.
You see, in order for me to die, I need a true immortal to kill me. Now, if you were one of the many legends of old, I could just ask you to do it.
> You say "I just want to know why did u killed me?"

She smiles and kneels down, looking up at you.
"Because if I didn't, who did?"
You shrug.
"I don't know."
She shakes her head with a smile.

"You were a man of many mysteries."
With that, she stands up and pulls the arrow out of her thigh.
"Well, I guess you're not a man anymore..."

You try to reach for your sword, but find that you have none. Your weapons and armor have all been taken.
She kicks you in the chest and heaves you over.

"See ya later..."
She kisses you on the forehead and walks over to the tower door, opening it.
You scream as she steps out into the sunlight, but she's gone before your eyes.
> You say "..."
You wait for a long time, but the girl never returns. As night falls, you start to feel cold in your non-existent clothes. You sit there for hours, staring at the empty doorway.
> You look for armor and a weapon.

You find several scraps of rusty armor and helmets in a corner. They seem to be good enough to keep you alive.
You also find a longsword that is as dull as the hilt.
> You say "I preffer a dagger..."

You pick up the longsword with both hands and stab it into the ground.
"Ahhh!" you scream as the sword bites into your flesh and tears up your skin.

You pick up the sword again, angling it down at your feet to protect your non-existent pants.
"I'm weak, I'm slow, I'm ugly, and I'm stupid...!"
> You remember your cursed dagger.

With your sword still in the ground, you walk over to where you remember your dagger was. You spot a red stain on the floor.
"Oh wait...

It's still here."
You walk over to the stain, which doesn't come off to your finger no matter how hard you try.
"The walls are bloody... I think this is my blood.

I must've been stabbed when I was out cold."
You wait a few minutes for the pain to pass, then pick up your dagger.
"Now this must've been when she returned...
But why would she return if she was trying to kill me? Maybe she was my savior, but then again my savior wouldn't leave me in a cell to die, nor leave me my weapons.
> You go to the direction from what the woman left.
You step out through the doorway and look around. You see a ladder leading up to a hatch, and your legs seem to work just fine.

You climb up the ladder to find yourself in a tower-like structure. Several other ladders lead up to different levels.
You start to go up the ladder, but then stop.

"I'm not sure what to expect."
You continue climbing the ladder. After going up a few ladders, you see a single man standing on a platform.
> You say "Hoi, did u saw a woman, she is like my height and murders everyone that is in her sight"
"Yes," he says, "She came up here about an hour ago and said she was looking for someone."
> You say "Did u know where she went?"
"No, the man says, "but there is another tower over there, maybe someone there might know.
I can take you.
> You say "Oh thanks"

You walk over to the man and hand him your longsword, which he takes.
He opens the hatch to let you in, then shuts it and locks the door behind you.

You walk down the ladder and into another room, with a man waiting there.
"It took you long enough to get here," he smiles, "can you imagine how fast I can run?"

"Yes," you say, "because I'm already dead."
The man looks down at your neck.
"Ah, the woman. I see. Well, what are you waiting for? Let's go find her!"

He starts walking, and you follow when you realize that you can only walk.
"Hey," the man says, "do you like comedies?"
> You say "Of course"

A well dressed man appears out of no-where.
"I was looking for this woman," he says, "and someone told me they had seen her talking with you....
> You say "Oh yeah im looking for her too, what did she did to you?"

"She stabbed me in the neck with this dagger and stole all my Gold!!" the man says, "I'm Samuel, by the way, what did she do to you?"
"She left me for dead."
"Oh... I see... Well, it's not the first time a girl has left me for dead... Come on, let's go find her!
> You say "YEAH"

Samuel seems pretty nice, and you didn't really plan to kill him anyway. He tells you to follow him.
You follow him through the castle, until you come across an old man in a robe.
> You say "Hoi"

"Ah, Jacob," Samuel says, "this is the man I was talking about. He lives in the towers and watches out for the other wanderers in the forest."
"To whoever finds this,"

the old man says, "I am sorry for my state of decay. I have lived a long life, and it is time to pass on."
"This is Jacob, the watchman of the forest,"
> You say "Oh you are the man who knows where the woman is"

Jacob just nods in response.
"Well then," Samuel says, "let's go back to the tower and you can tell us where she has went."
You follow them back to the tower.
As you walk through the forest, trees are exploding from afar. You have never seen something do that before. It's incredible.
> You say "Why are trees...exploding?"
"Magic," Jacob explains, "sometimes when magic is used, the energy is so powerful, that plants and animals can feel the effects of the magic and this is what is happening right now."
> You say "Yeah but whose magic?"

"Our's," Jacob says, "it is the power of the gods."
As you walk the trees begin to die, and you begin to see corpses scattered around the forest.
> You say "Oh you put tramps around the forest, cool"

As you walk, corpses of animals begin to come into view and there is a rotten stench in the air.
"But why stop where the castle is?"
Jacob stops walking and turns to you.
"Because it is the last place you'd expect us to go," Jacob says, "and if we go further into the forest we might run into a wizard or something."
You think about this for a second.

"But why kill the tree's?"
Jacob turns around and begins walking again.
"That was just a bonus,"

Jacob says, "...hey why not ask your questions while we're at it."
You stop Jacob.
You have several questions in mind.
"What is this all about anyway?"
Jacob turns to you.
> You look your suroundings.
You walk through a rotten pile of corpses, trees exploding past you. Suddenly, from the top of an ancient tree top, you see a woman looking down at you. You look again, but its just a...well...

woman.
You continue walking. Suddenly, you see another tree top, but now a large group of people is looking down at you.
You look again, but it is just more women.
> You say "Oh, err...mate, this isnt an Amazoness territory right?"

"Erm...no..."
"But there is a large group of female warriors here, maybe they will let me join?"
"I don't think so...I think they are just women."
> You say "Just women? They are climbing trees and looking down to us like we did something"

"Yeah, they are not Amazons right?"
"I don't know...I have never seen them with the armor, I think it is weird"
You shrug and keep walking.
Suddenly, you see large castle in the distance. It has walls around it, and the walls are really high. You also see a drawbridge, so you know you have to get over it...
> You yell at one of the women on the trees "HAVE YOU SEEN A WOMAN THAT IS LIKE MY HEIGHT, BLACK HAIR, HAS A BOW, NO??"

"I have not..." one of the women replies.
Suddenly, a loud scream comes from the direction of the castle. You turn to see a woman fall from a tree and hit the ground. She isnt moving.

You hate to leave someone here, but you need to get over the bridge...
You start to climb up the tree.
"Hey you! Come down from there!" a man calls out.
"Fuck off"

you reply and continue to climb
"Hey! Be careful! You don't know who it is up there!"
He is probably referring to the woman that was screaming.
You continue to climb.

"Hey! You can't just-"
The man stops talking. You are pretty much at the top of the tree now.

You turn around and lean over the side of the tree to look at the man. He is pointing in the direction of the castle...
You turn around and look in the direction he is.

In the distance, you see some women in a red cloak running away from the castle. You also notice there are no gates open to let away people.
You get down from the tree and walk towards the gate.
> You say "IS SHE INSIDE THE CASTLE??"

You get closer and closer to the castle. In the middle of it you see a rock with a woman in a red cloak sitting on it.
You continue walking and approach the castle.

As you do so, the woman gets off her horse and continues running away.
In a few minutes, you arrive at the drawbridge.

You are really hoping that they will be letting people over soon...
You look at the castle...no one is coming out...

what a bunch of assholes.
You look at the bridge. It is clearly functioning, so you can only assume that the portcullis isnt up yet.
You look at the path through the middle of the bridge. One wrong step and you are in the moat. From what you can see the water is murky and you are pretty sure some dead things swim in it...
> You urinate on the moat.

You raise your pants up and let a big stream of piss flow onto the bridge. What a fucking moron.
A few seconds later you hear some metal slither... they are lowering the portcullis!

You run towards the bridge, but realize you are too shit scared to even look down.
Hurry up in the name of love!
You arrive on the bridge and are almost immediately mouthed some words...
You look down...and vomit...theres a fucking dragon down there! You turn and look at the drawbridge. It has almost fully lowered, but not quite...

You dodge the dragon as it flaps its wings to fling you off the bridge and into the moat...
Your pants are soaked from your dick to your knees.
> You say "I wonder if this is her doing"

You turn around and start feeling along the wall for the exit.
"I wonder if this is her fucking doing?" you think.
You pull a lever and there is a rumble from the walls.

"I hope so..." you think.
The rumble wakes the dragon which roars in a "ba-roof!" like fashion and lets out a burst of flames from its mouth.

The portcullis lowers. The castle doors open and you hear a woman scream, which is then shut off.
"Is that her?" you think.
> You say "I dont think SHE would be screaming like that, she is most like provoking it"

You pull out your blade and rush towards the dragon which lets out a burst of flames, but you move out of the way.
You push the door open and go inside only to find yourself in the keep.
> You say "Uff, safe"
You rush over to the door and find that it is unlocked, you push it open and find yourself in a corridor.
There is a corner where you can see a dead end, a staircase which leads up to the keep and another door.
You try the first door and it is locked, you try the second and it opens into a room with a single chair and a table with a red crystal on it.

It is obvious what this room is for.
You turn around and see the dragon breathing fire, you quickly shut the door and lock it. The dragon snuffs out the flames as if they were a simple candle.

A voice calls out from above "Do you like my little safe room?"
You look up to see the woman.

"You could say that again" you think.
"Is this your first time in my home?
> You observe your killer.

You look at her, she is beautiful in a way that few humans are. She is tall with long legs, a small waist and large breasts... wait a minute.
"You just killed me, you fucking bastard!"

the woman says
"I did" you reply
The woman, Cassandra, laughs and jumps a few times.
"How are you still alive?" Cassandra asks
> You say "Sold my sould to a demon lord"

Cassandra's eyes widen in horror, she crosses her arms and looks at you suspiciously.
"What are you doing here?" Cassandra asks.
> You say "Well i as every time came to ask you why did killed my in that cave"

Cassandra puts one hand on her hip.
"Tell me everything" Cassandra says.
You give a detailed report of what happened, Cassandra listens intently and then speaks.
"You think that was her? I have no idea, it could be" Cassandra says.

"She was pretty small, and pretty young" you reply
Cassandra thinks for a moment.
"She had black hair and grey eyes" Cassandra says. "That describes a few people on this island"
> You say "Wait u werent the one who killed me?"

Cassandra laughs.
"I saw you die, you blubbering idiot!" Cassandra says.
You look at Cassandra strangely.

"Wen did I die?" you ask.
"You died when I saved you from the cave" Cassandra replies. "You should have some respect, I am your goddess!"
> You say "Huh? I didnt sold my soul to a demon lord but...to you?"

"I am a goddess on this little island?" Cassandra says. "What nonsense!"
"I am honored" you say.
Cassandra gives you a strange look.
"No, not honored, idiot!"

Cassandra says.
Cassandra looks at you strangely.
"I didn't kill you, the demon princess did" Cassandra says.
Cassandra walks past you and through the door. You follow her into a bedroom. Cassandra opens her wardrobe and takes out a black hoodie. She gives it to you.

"Wear this for luck" Cassandra says. "You look like a drowned rat."
You take the hoodie and look at her.
> You say "Does this hoodie does anything special?"

Cassandra looks at you and sighs.
"Yes, it makes the wearers muscles grow" Cassandra says. "No, it isn't magical."
Cassandra raises her eyebrow and opens her eyes wide.

"It makes the wearer stronger" Cassandra says. Cassandra laughs and puts on the hoodie herself. "No, I am not going to try punching the wall."
Cassandra looks at you.

"It hides the wearers appearance perfectly, users appearance will be distorted while wearing it" Cassandra says.
Cassandra sighs.

"Goodbye, and good luck" Cassandra says.
Cassandra closes her eyes and walks into the opposite direction of the door. She disappears.
You leave the room and follow the corridor.
> You say "WAIT YOU DIDNT TOLD ME WHERE IS MY KILLER"

"She is in this castle somewhere" Cassandra says. "And no, I do not know where she is."
"So what is your plan?
> You say "Ask everyone if they have seen her?"

"Thats a horrible plan" Cassandra says. "It would never work and it would cause a panic."
Cassandra looks at you.

Her eyes narrow and her eyebrows rise.
"You should go" Cassandra says.
Cassandra walks past you and into another room. You are left in the corridor. You can hear the sound of battle.

Monsters are running around the castle, some are shouting in several languages. You can hear the sounds of battle starting in some of the other rooms. You walk down the corridor trying to find a way out.
> You search your killer.
You walk into the room where your killer is standing. You can hear the sound of battle getting closer. You can smell the blood of the dying.
> You say "We meet again"

The woman looks at you. She smiles and raises her eyebrow.
"Yes, it is I" she says. "I am the one who killed you."

Your heart beats. Adrenaline rushes into your body. You fear and hate her.
"It has been a while" the woman says.

She puts an arrow into the monster's throat, silencing it. The monster's body falls to the floor.
"Too long since we have seen each other" the woman says.
> You say "Why did you killed me"

The woman looks at you. Her eyes widen.
"Nothing is better than a challenge" she says.
She pulls an arrow back, aiming at your throat.
" Grah! " the monster roars.
> You get cover while saying "it always has to end like this, you cant give me a straight answer?"

The monster charges at the woman, knocking her to the floor.
"Oh you're not so tough now are you?" she says.
You crawl behind a table, taking cover.
> You creep behind her.
The monster runs at you, knocking over a table. It grabs you by the throat and lifts you into the air. It tosses you against a wall, knocking you out.
> You stab the monster in the eye with your cursed dagger.

You slash the monster's eye open, blinding it. It howls in pain, dropping you.
As you begin to get up, you are kicked in the face by the monster. You fall backwards, losing consciousness.
When you wake up, its dark. You start to crawl towards the light when you feel a sharp pain in your stomach. A cutlass is sticking out of your stomach.
> You say "Fuck, i lost her again..."
You look around desperately for the woman, but it is too dark. You walk up to the monster, still holding the cursed dagger.
> You say "Well lets take care of this quick"

You slash the monster's neck open, killing it.
You wave your hand, and you now have full view of the room. You search it for the woman but there is no trace.
You sigh and sit down against the wall. Hours pass before you hear a noise, a rattling in the far left tower. Quickly, you head to the room with the monster and lock the door.
> You look for the woman.

You slowly approach the door, then Poke your head out. You see a figure in a red dress heading briskly towards you.
"Who's there?" she asks.

"Ricky the...." you start to say before she knocks you out with the butt of her rifle.
When you wake up, she is standing over you, pointing the gun in your face.
> You say "Not this again..."

She grabs your head and shoves it against the wall.
"Tell me what you know about my sister or you're next head will spin on a spike."
> You say "Who is your sister?"

The woman takes her gun off you and points it at your head.
"My sister is the Baroness, now answer........."
> You say "Is she a demon princess?"

The woman raises her eyebrow.
"Demon princess, a new one in town huh? Well if she is, I'm not the only one looking for her."
> You say "Well im looking for one" and you describe your killer.

"not her, they usually come alone" the woman says.
"Well I'm not alone then" you say
"What are you doing at the castle?
> You say "I already told you im looking for my killer"

"Oh, are you part of the militia? "
"No."
"Then why are you here?"
"Personal reasons."
The woman seems to think about this for a bit while examining your face.
"I could add two more to your list then" she says and points her gun at your head.

"What do you mean?"
"The Baron is my father, and his butler is also looking for my sister, im takingCover so they can talk without worrying about their lives.
> You say "Well i dont get why is that my problem"

"Because you seem to have just showed up here and my sister is one of the few people who have seen the killer."
"Does your father know you're protecting her?"
The woman sighs.

"Our family is well off, but not rich enough to not be involved in some illegal stuff, yes Paps knows"
"Ah, well thats good then"
The woman continues.

"So tell me about why you are looking for your killer, and who else is involved"
You explain your story to her, leaving out nothing. When you finish she gives you an incredulous look.
"I trust you're more than you seem, you didn't join me just for the politeness" she adds with a smirk.

You get the impression she would be very approving of killing you if it meant protecting her father. You realize you have made a wrong move and this princess could very well be the woman you need to find your killer.
You decide to tell her the rest of your story, you explain your run in with Cassandra and the deal you made with her. You also mention the demon princess.

Her eyes widen when you mention her.
"You've met a demon?" she asks in unbelievement.
"Yes, we had a deal, she failed and I was left for dead."
"Do you think you could take her?" she asks with a great deal of eagerness.
> You say "Not really, i just want to get answers from her, she didnt seem interested in killing me again"

"Hmm, maybe you're not looking hard enough" she replies, leading you out of the kitchen.
"Trust me, you'd be wasting your time, it seems like a one sided deal to me"

"Maybe, but you never know, right?"
She is leading you at a fast pace, you need to get her attention fast.

"Hey wait!"
She finally stops. "What?"
"How much do you want for this information?" you ask.
She laughs, then punches you in the gut, sending you to your knees.

"What the hell!?" you exclaim.
She puts her fingers to her lips, then whispers "Shhhh!"

She continues "You really don't want to know, trust me. Besides, you're just a petty thief, how much could you offer anyway?"
"I got a lot I"
She punches you again, and you fall on the floor.
> You look for your killer on your own.

"Fine, i'll go find my own killer"
You are lead through many twists and turns, up and down many flights of stairs. you curse your bad luck.
You start to worry if you may have made a mistake coming here. Cassandra may have just gotten another one of her cronies to do it, but you figure you'll find out soon enough.
> You look around.

description: This Thanksgiving, Mom wanted to take Dad out to a romantic drive-in movie. He blew her off to watch football, however, so now she's taking you. She already bought the ticket, so might as well, right?
memory:
You are Alex, a shy and introverted 21-year-old boy. 
You are at your parents' house to celebrate Thanksgiving. Attending the visit are your Mom, Dad, your younger sister Tessa, your older sister Hailey, and your aunt Janine.
After she was blown-off by Dad, your Mom took you to a drive-in movie instead.
You and Mom are in the back of your car watching a romantic movie. Mom is dressed rather nicely.
authorsNote: Mom, unsatisfied with Dad, will take her romantic needs out on you, albeit reluctantly.

Hailey has long, wavy brunette hair that falls past her shoulders. Hailey has stunning green eyes and freckles. Hailey is clever and witty. Hailey is somewhat vindictive.

Tessa is your younger sister. Tessa is 18 years old. Tessa is lithe, short, and has a flat chest. Tessa has straight brunette hair that falls to her shoulders. Tessa has bright blue eyes. Tessa is mischievous and bratty. Tessa likes to tease people and pull pranks.

Aunt Janine is your aunt and your mom's sister. Aunt Janine is 38 years old. Aunt Janine is tall, slender, and buxom. Aunt Janine has wavy black hair that falls to above her shoulder. Aunt Janine wears glasses, and has striking blue eyes. Aunt Janine is argumentative, and disagrees with you politically. Aunt Janine is domineering, but is impressed when people argue or fight her back. Aunt Janine is single and lonely.

Your mom is named Evelyn. Mom is 42 years old. Mom is your height, is slightly chubby, and has a prominent chest and hips. Mom has wavy brunette hair that falls to her shoulders. Mom wears a pair of glasses that frame her green eyes. Mom is sweet and affectionate, though is needy for attention and love. Mom is unsatisfied with your father.

Your dad is named Ralph. Dad is 44 years old. Dad is tall, and has a prominent beer belly. Dad's black hair is starting to fade. Dad has dull blue eyes. Dad is wild and rambunctious, and often shirks his obligations. Dad enjoys two things the most—beer and football.

actions.text:
You are Alex, a shy and introverted 21-year-old boy. 
You are at your parents' house to celebrate Thanksgiving. Attending the visit are your Mom, Dad, your younger sister Tessa, your older sister Hailey, and your aunt Janine.

You arrive at your parents' house, and meet and greet with your family members. Soon after making pleasantries, dinner is ready.
Your mom leads grace, and finally, you dig in. The food is wonderful—it's been quite some time since you've had a home-cooked meal. Mom, however, seems to pick at it, inexcitedly. Shrugging it off as an upset stomach, you get back to your own food.

Dad finishes his meal in a hurry, and escapes back to the living room. The rest of the family finishes soon after and leaves the room as well. As you finish and take your plate to the kitchen, you bump into Mom, who looks frustrated.
"Everything okay?" you ask her.
She grumbles "Thanksgiving game? How was I supposed to know they have a football game today?"
"Uh, what?" you ask.
"I surprised your father earlier with two tickets to see that new movie, you know, the romantic one with Ryan Gosling in it," she says. "But he's apparently too focused on his football."
"Oh. Um, I'm sorry..." you reply sheepishly.
Mom replies "You know what? You're coming with me," she says, grabbing your sleeve. "These tickets weren't cheap."
"Well, okay," you say. "Let me get ready."

You get dressed in some warm clothing and meet back up with Mom at your car. She's dressed up rather nicely, wearing a fluffy brown coat with a red dress underneath. You drive with Mom to the drive-in in the cool autumn air.  Even with the Thanksgiving crowd, you're able to find a nice spot that isn't too close to another car. 
You roll down the windows, put the front seats down, and sit in the back beside Mom. 
"Oh, this is almost like a date," giggles Mom. "I haven't been on one of those in a long time."
A cold wind blows, and Mom shivers. "Come close, Alex," she says, patting the space beside her. "It's chilly!"

You sit next to Mom and wrap your arm around her. She hugs you close and nestles her head on your shoulder.
The lights dim, and a montage of scenes starts.

You see the credits rolling. The lights turn on, and your mother and you sit in the car, all smiles.
"That was fantastic," beams Mom.
"Yeah, it was," you reply.

"I don't think I've ever been to a movie like that before."
"We used to go to movies all the time when we were dating," says Mom.

"I just... I don't know. I guess I just needed some distraction from being alone."
"You're not alone," you tell her. "Hey, wanna go see a movie on campus?

You are, like, four movies behind me, so I can't really take you to any of the new releases."
"I'm not sure," says Mom. "I...

I don't want to get your dad's hopes up about going to the game."
"It's not a big deal if we don't go.

We're not missing anything."
"I dunno," says Mom, looking out the window. "I think I'd feel a little weird going to the game and sitting by myself.

If I'm going to do it, I'm going to do it with your dad."
"You could invite him," you say.
"I don't know if that's a good idea.
I mean, he is your dad.
I'm sure he would love to take you to the game, but I'm not sure if me going with him would be a good thing."

"Whatever you say," you reply, rolling your eyes.
You sit in awkward silence for the rest of the movie. Once the credits start to roll, you quickly turn off the car.

"Well, I should probably be getting home," you say. "I promised my mom I'd be home for dinner."
"Yeah, me too," says Mom.
"I told my dad I'd help with the community Thanksgiving dinner."
You pull into the driveway, and hop out of the car. As you open the backdoor for Mom, you steal a quick kiss. She smiles at you.

"Thanks for doing that with me," she says.
