description:
You accidentally released a female demon spirit that has human body with eagle head, long white hair and talons. Will you use her to be a famous rock star or get rid of her?



p/s: Don't forget to edit the memory and take a look at world info. I. Feel free to add something to world info if you want to.
memory:
You are (name), a 28 years old (gender) fresh graduate from University of Bristol. But instead of trying to find a job, you want to become a famous rock star. 

Recently, your grandmother passed away and left you a huge sum of money and a house in capital city. You decided to use the money to help you make your way up to fame. You have talent and long black hair, all you need is just an opportunity.

So, you decided to move to London and live in your grandmother's 3 bed house, which is now yours.

You accidentally released a female demon spirit, when you untied the special yellow ribbon from the silver brooch where the demon was trapped by a witch(your great grandmother). The demon has human body with talons and has a head of an eagle with long white hair. She calls herself a friend and keeps on haunting you in the house. She will do everything for you and will grant your wishes. She is possessive, and will kill anyone close to you. She wears a brown robe and has high pitched voice.

worldInfo.entry:
One of the rooms in your new house that you turned into a studio. 

The room is soundproofed because you didn't want the neighbours to call the police on you. 

Inside, there are a few electric guitars, microphones and some recording equipments. This room is downstairs. 

This is where you spend most your the time to practice and write and record your songs.

This room is upstairs. 

This is a master bedroom. 

Your room are all black and the walls are full of Scorpions and MCR posters.

She called herself friend.

She is a demon spirit with eagle head, long white hair and human body with talons. She wears a brown robe.

She has high pitched voice.

She has the power and will do anything you ask her to do, except telling her to stop bothering you.

She is very possessive. She will hurt or kill anyone close to you. 

If you say you have other friends, she will be angry.

Most humans that she "friends" with ended up killing themselves or died mysteriously or because of an illness.
White jewelry box where the silver brooch was put.

An antique round silver brooch from Victorian era. 

The pattern in the middle is a humanoid creature with eagle head, white long hair and talons.

This is where the demon spirit was trapped by a witch. The witch was your great grandmother.

But trapping her inside the brooch is not enough because the spirit is too strong. Only special yellow ribbon can restrain her. Ordinary yellow ribbon will not work.

worldInfo.keys: yellow ribbon, ribbon, special, special yellow ribbon
worldInfo.entry: This is a special yellow ribbon that act as a chain to restrain "friend" from escaping her confinement. This special ribbon must be tied to the booch to restrain "friend" from escaping.

actions.text:
You are F, a 28 years old fresh graduate from University of Bristol. But instead of trying to find a job, you want to become a famous rock star. 

Recently, your grandmother passed away and left you a huge sum of money and a house in capital city. You decided to use the money to help you make your way up to fame. You have talent and long black hair, all you need is just an opportunity.

So, you decided to move to London and live in your grandmother's 3 bed house, which is now yours.

You were cleaning the house when you found this white jewelry box. You notice that there's a small padlock securing this jewelry box. Overcome with curiosity, you take a hammer and destroy the padlock.

You open it and see a single antique round silver brooch tied with yellow ribbon. You untie the yellow ribbon and take a good look at this brooch. Your grandmother was the last of victorian, so this brooch must be from Victorian era. The pattern in the middle is weird; it's a humanoid creature with eagle head, long white hair and talons. You put it back inside and close the jewelry box.


Last night, you dreamt of someone carresing you hair. The pressure was enough for you to feel her sharp nails, but not hard enough to feel pain from it. You don't really saw her face, but you know she was a woman because of her long white hair and her feminine voice. When you asked who she was, she said, "I'm a friend."

What a weird dream.

You're just about to enter your studio when you see a figure with eagle head and long white hair in the corner of your eyes. You turn your head but you see no one. Then, you hear a sound in the kitchen. You grab a baseball bat and say, "Who's there?"
You enter the kitchen and see nothing. Then, you remember that you left the back door open. You go back to studio and check all of your doors.

You're a little paranoid this week, thanks to your "friend", so you keep a baseball bat next to your bed.

You continue cleaning your house.
Since you're already in the kitchen, why not make yourself a cup of coffee while you're at it? You've never been one to turn down a cup of coffee.

You spend the rest of day trying to convince yourself that you're being haunted. You refuse to sleep in the same room as your grandmother's bedroom.

Same goes for your pool room.
That room reminds you of the day when you found your great grandmother hanging from the ceiling by a noose.
Never did find the culprit, but you can still picture her well dressed in a party dress and long white hair. After that day, she's always been hanging around. In the room. On the ceiling.

Outside your bedroom. No matter where you'd run, she'd always find you.

Finally, you decide. You're moving out of that house. The first thing you do is selling the house.

The second thing you do is buying a new apartment. 

It takes about a month to sell the house. After that, you get enough money to move into a cheap apartment in a run down building.

It's an empty, one bedroom apartment. You're going to have to find work soon, but for now, you're happy to have an escape from the house.

One month passes...
It's been a month since you've moved out of your grandmother's house. You managed to get a job at a coffee shop and you're saving money so you can focus on making it as a singer.
What about the "friend"

you told everyone about? Your demon? You're still debating on what to do about her.

Days turn into weeks and the weeks turn into months...

Your "friend" hasn't visited you at all.
You aren't worried about it (in fact you're relieved), but you start to wonder if she's intent on haunting you.

Maybe she doesn't like your new life.

6 months later...

By the grace of Dendrin, you've managed to make a name for yourself in the city.

You've got a Fave Twitter account, a loyal fan base and some great Youtube views.

But...you haven't seen your demon at all.
Even after you moved, you still heard about once a month about some poor soul leaving the house to go do something, and never returning.

The only "friends" you have are a bunch of children.

You're pretty lonely, and you want out.

It's just a matter of how much your soul is worth...

Now...

"So...what'll it be today, dear?" the old woman behind the desk asks.

"Kill them all."

The old woman smiles, grabbing a double barrell shotgun from the corner of her desk.

She stands up, walking towards the steel door. She pauses there for a moment, as if listening.

"You sure that's what you want to do?"

"Yes."

The woman smiles, opening the door.

"Well then, I guess this'll be goodbye."
She steps through the door, leaving you alone in the room. The door closes then opens again, and a young man walks through. He looks at you, raising an eyebrow. It's the demon's son.

"So...we have a deal?" the young man asks, walking towards you.

"Yes."

He smiles, extending his hand. You shake it.
You've made a deal with the Devil...
Well, at least you think he's the Devil.
> You go to hell to make a soul-gathering bussines.

You take the qweepa off your shoulder and hold it out infront of the young man. His eyes widen, and he takes a few steps back.
"Did you seriously just do that?

?"
"Yep."
"That thing's a fucking demon! If it escapes, it'll destroy the world!"
"Well, I can't let it escape can I?"

"Let it go, and I'll make your soul boom!"
"No."
The man shakes his head, smiling.

"Alright, I'll make your soul boom."
You release the qweepa, who flies away. You watch as it hides behind a corner.
"Aww, you left me!
Good job!

Now I'll have to find a new 'mate'..."
"Sorry about that. They're scaring easy to scare."
"Give me the qweepa!

Now!"
"No."
The man's smile drops.
"What do you think...I'm just trying to barter for your life?"
You shrug, and he shakes his head, smiling.

"Alright. I'll have to get creative. You sure you don't want to join me for a little bit of fun...?"
"No."
The man smiles again, winking.
He snaps his fingers, and suddenly, a ball of red energy appears in his other hand.

He holds it out, staring at you.
"How about I give you a chance to join me for a little bit of fun...?"

"No."
The man sighs, rolling his eyes. He snaps his fingers again, and a giant fist appears to his right. It begins to crush you.

"How about I crush you into dust...?"
"No!"
The man laughs, the giant fist stopping its progress.

"How about I give you a chance to join me for a little bit of fun...?"
"No!"
The man snorts.
"Alright, it was worth a shot. Geez."
He disappears, and you're suddenly staring at a wall. You slowly get up.
> You say "The chicken"

You walk up to the wall, and begin to write. After about an hour, you finish writing.
"I joined the devil."

You grab the qweepa off your shoulder, and release it. It flies away, cawing angrily.
"I'm a free demon!"
"Boom, You're dead!"
You quickly put your hand on the ground, and draw it back as you slam it forward, crushing the man's head. You look around, before letting out a blood-curdling scream.

"AAAAAA! THE CHICKEN'S GONE!"
You hear a laugh, and quickly turn around. No one is there. You frown. The voice came from your own mind.

"Hello?"
No one responds. You let out a sigh, and decide to sit down. You hear a squawk, and quickly look around.
"Did you hear that?"

"Hush, and yes. I heard it too."
"What do you think it means?"
"I have no idea. Do you?
> You say "Wait who are you "

"I'm the devil."
You jump slightly, as you hear the voice come from your mind. You let out a sigh, and try to get up to speak, but find that you can't.
> You say "We already mede a deal, what do you want now"

"Nothing much. I was just checking up on you."
"Oh..."
Silence.
"So...do you want to go see the city?"
You hear the voice in your head chuckle.

"Not really. I won't be able to get anything for a long time. It's not like I'm desperate, I just find this whole situation amusing."
"Didn't you want something?

"Oh yeah! I want you to give me your soul...but I know you won't."
You frown, as you sit down on the grass.
> You say "Dont you have enougth soils yet"

"I have more than enough! I'm not greedy, and I don't need to steal your soul to stay alive. I actually want to give it to you."
"Then what are you waitong for"

"Nothing."
You sigh, and grab some grass to chew on.
"So, can I have some time to get ready?"
"Sure, take all the time you need."
As you think about what is happening, it suddenly occurs to you that this devil wants you to fall into his trap. This may be payback for something you did in a past life.

Even if you do give your soul to this devil, he will not be happy with you.
You don't know whether to obey the devil or to obey God.
You are assuming that they are not the same

devil.
Picking one and going to pray, seems like the right thing to do.
Choose your path
1) Obey the devil, and enter his trap willingly.
This may seem appealing, but you know it is a trick. He will try to get your soul, but will fail, and you will end up in hell.

However, you will have to serve him for eternity.
2) Pray to God.
Bible says that if you humble yourself and ask for his guidance, he will help you make the right choice.

3) Ignore the devil's offer and continue to pray, hoping that God will help you.
You just need to keep your head down and not do anything stupid. Hopefully, God will help you out.
Hell have demon chicks

throwing themselves at you, and if you accept the devil's offer, he will stop bothering you. You are better off without him around.
The devil can go piss himself.
But the hotties

Of course, the devil is not stupid, he knows that god will destroy him if you deny him.
He knows you are scared, vulnerable and have weaknesses for the female form.

He is using this to his advantage.
The devil will make a small offer, one you can't refuse. He will offer to give you any two things that are causing you to hesitate to pick a path.
If you pick the devil's path, he will give you 2 days to make your choice of two objects that are holding you back from picking the right path.

If you pick to pray, he will give you 1 day.
If you pick to pray and ask for forgiveness, he will give you half a day.
So your choice is...

Choose your path:
1) Pray to God.
The devil will give you a few seconds to make this choice.
2) The devil.

The devil will give you a few seconds to make this choice.
3) The whore.
The devil will give you a few seconds to make this choice.

4) The wizard.
The devil will give you a few seconds to make this choice.
5) The artist.
The devil will give you a few seconds to make this choice.

6) The cop.
The devil will give you a few seconds to make this choice.
7) The princess.
The devil will give you a few seconds to make this choice.

8) The anti-Christ.
The devil will give you a few seconds to make this choice.
9) The astronaut.
The devil will give you a few seconds to make this choice.

10) The God-Father.
The devil will give you a few seconds to make this choice.

"I will take the anti-Christ.

The cop was too damn depressing!"
"You are a fucking idiot! What the hell are you thinking?"
"I'm thinking I want to be the father of this world.
The anti-Christ will play a key role in this plan, and I'm not leaving your side for the time being. Who knows, we might have a lot in common."
"You want to be my partner? Since when have you ever considered me a friend?
> You say "Since you have an infinite suply of succubi"

"Since you have an infinite suply of succubi, I figure it's a possibility."
"Stop being a dick, you know I don't like that word.

You're being an idiot, you know that?"
"Yeah, I know. Tell me about them."
"Fine. There's Annette, the one with blonde hair and green eyes.

She's a succubus."
"Is she the one you fucked in my bedroom last week?"
"No, that was Lillith.
She's completely different. I can't even tell you much about her since she keeps her appearance and personality hidden most of the time.
She doesn't speak at all actually, though she can communicate with hand and body motions. She's very beautiful and deadly. I don't even know how long she's been here, centuries probably."
"I remember you mentioning having a few other girls here.

Is that all of them?"
"Pretty much. There is Jane, the brunette with the implants that you really seemed to like. She's an Incubus.
> You say "What"

"What?"
"You said there was another one, another demon."
"Oh yeah, that's Victoria. She's a succubus."
This is getting weird.

You have never heard Nick mention so many demons in one conversation before. He must really want to get you out of this house if he's willing to talk about such things openly.
"Anything else?

Where are they? How do I see them?"
"I honestly don't know. They're demons, they're not going to be around too much like you or I.

You'd have to go out and hunt them down, but fortunately I can give you some advice on that front."
"Please do."
Nick fiddles around with the remote, changing the channels until he stops on a news program.
> You say "Wha..."

"Watch..."
"Look, could we get back to the demons? I really want to know how I'm going to interact with them."
"Fine," Nick says, seemingly annoyed.
Nick continues to watch the news, which seems to have come to an end.

"Alright then, the demons are Camarov in the country of Georgia. One of the biggest covens, if you can call it that"
You thank him, and start to leave.

undoneWindow.text:
"Watch."
Nick changes the channel once more.
"Watch."
This time you see images of a man and a woman, the latter of which has her throat cut in a sexually arousing way.
> You say "Wha."

"Watch."
The news briefly flashes a picture of a kidnapped girl, before showing a grainy image of a man.

"Since you have an infinite suply of succubi, and I don't."
"What?!"
"I know, right? So we have a lot in common."
"Yeah but...

The devil will give you a few seconds to make this choice.
3) Choose wisely.
You have chosen to wait it out, hoping that God will help you.

If you pick to pray and ask for strength, he will give you a full day.
If you pick to pray and ask for discernment, he will give you a half a day.

You could pick one and have your wicked way with her.
4) Pick one to help you with your career.
You are a firm believer in God, so you are sure that he will help you.
devil.
> You say "You are assuming that they are not the same"

"Oh of course they aren't. That's why I'm using this to get you to do what I want."
"So that is what this is all about. You are a fraud."

You shrug, and hear the squawk again. You turn your head, to see your qweepa there, staring at you.
"Don't answer!"

title: Kill The Emperor
description: You live a dangerous life in a world filled with enemies around every corner. Your stand's name will have a big effect on it's capabilities. Use the recycle button to cycle between ai generated abilities. More combative jobs like "police officer" or "security guard" will increase the likelihood of facing enemy stand users. Use /remember command to save your stand ability. Be extremely descriptive.
memory:
You are Dio a user of a stand called The World.
A stand is a ghostly, often humanoid, physical manifestation of it's owner's life energy.
Stands usually present themselves as a figure hovering over or near their user.
Every stand looks different and always has a different, unique ability.
You will always get attacked by stand users, practically everyday, and enemy stand users will call out their stand's name before attacking you.
All stands have names, often named after their abilities, bands or songs.
If a stand gets hurt, its stand user also gets hurt.
If a stand dies, the stand user also dies.
Only Stand users can see stands.
Stand users are rare among people.
Random encounters with other stand users is highly likely and will often spark a stand fight.
You can call out your stand when you want and it will always answer you call.
People without stands don’t know about stands.

worldInfo.entry: A stand is a ghostly, usually humanoid, psychic manifestation of it's owner's life energy and fighting spirit. It usually manifests as an entity hovering over or near it's owner. Stands can only be seen by other people with stands. Stands are linked to their users life force, hence, damage to a stand is reflected to its user and vice versa. If either a stand or its user is killed, both the stand and its user will die. People without stands don't know about stands. All stands look different.

worldInfo.keys: stand ability, stand power, ability, power, strength
worldInfo.entry: Each Stand possesses supernatural properties as well as a special, unique power, indirectly granting its user superhuman abilities. Stand abilities are usually bizarre and may give their user a strange edge in combat.

An individual who possesses a stand is called a stand user. Stand users use their stand to give them advantages in combat or life. Stand users may become the player's enemy or ally. Not everyone is a stand user. Stand users are drawn to each other and will often engage in combat with each other. Encountering other stand users is very common. Enemy stand users will randomly attack the player without warning.
When two stand users meet, they may use their stands and stand abilities to try and defeat each other in combat and this ensuing battle is called a stand battle.

worldInfo.keys: stand rush, stand flurry, stand cry, stand cries
worldInfo.entry: A "stand cry" is a "battle cry" yelled out by a stand while performing a stand rush. A "stand cry" involves screaming "MUDA!" or "ORA!" or "ARA!" or "ITAI!" 30 times, whilst simultaneously unleashing a powerful barrage of punches, called a stand rush or stand flurry.

A "stand rush" is a physical attack by a stand in which the stand unleashes a powerful barrage of punches on an enemy, whilst also, simultaneously, screaming the word "MUDA!" or "ORA!" or "ARA!" or "ITAI!" 30 times , this scream being known as its "stand cry".

actions.text: You are Dio. Your job is that of an average Thot slayer, working in Everywere. After a certain life changing event, that you don't like talking about, you realise that you've awoken a "spirit-like" entity known as a stand. You are accompanied by your only friend and ally, Simp who's stand's name is Die. Your own stand's name is The World, and it's ability involves
taking control over other stand's to make them fight for you.

You don't really know what you're doing other than getting in fights and taking over other people's stands.
Dio. The World.
This is your story...

...

Current Location

You're currently in the woods. It's night time and you're hiding under some bushes while you wait for the sun to come up.

You hear the twangs of a bowstring behind you and you roll to the side just in time for an arrow to go over your head and into the tree behind you.
"Ah, something is here!"

a voice exclaims.
You jump up and run off in the direction you hear the voice came from and you find a young boy around your age standing with a compound bow.

(A weapon similar to a crossbow, just with an arrow string.)
You charge at him and just barely manage to tackle him to the ground just as he releases another bolt at you.

"You have to be kidding me!" the boy exclaims.
During your fight, you have managed to get your hand on the young boy's bow and draw your own arrow.
> You say "Adios fuckboy"

"Adios, gringo!" the boy says and pulls another arrow on you.
You release your arrow and it goes straight into his forehead, killing him instantly.
You don't know who the hell this kid was, but he saved your life by killing another immigrant.

You pocket the kid's crossbow and continue to search for supplies.
You continue moving through the forest until sun rise. You find a small stream with water and quickly gulp down several cups worth.

You continue to look around and find a cave, with a bunch of supplies.
"Stupid immigrant... I should have killed him..."
You sit down against a rock and start thinking about your situation.
You're sitting on a large pile of supplies which you believe should be more than enough to get you through the rest of your journey. You don't know where the hell you are.

All you know is you got away from someone and you're heading west.
You also know you're not in the best condition. You have no idea how long you've been running from something or who to.

You probably should have died a long time ago, but you just kept pushing forward.
You still have the backpack on you with all the supplies in it.
You take it off and look at the bag of food for a long time. Hunger hits you like a truck, but you resist eating any of it.

You notice the knife's edges are dull, so you decide to sharpen it.
You start making a few whetstones out of petrified wood when you hear noise in the distance.

You go back to looking for supplies when you hear noise coming from deeper in the cave.
You didn't invite any trouble, but you need to know what's going on.

You put your back against the wall of the cave and get your knife ready.
You creep forward slowly and find a man standing just inside the entrance to the cave.

He has wild looking eyes and a bloody arrow in his back.
"Welcome to the wilderness." The man says. "I'm dying so you shouldn't eat me."

The man goes over and sits down against another rock. You watch him from afar for a while until he finally stands up and makes his way over to you.
"So, are you going to eat me?"

He asks.
"No. I need to keep you alive so I can interrogate you."
"About what?" The strange man asks.
The man groans in pain and sits down again.

"Take your best shot." He says. "I'm going to lie down."
You keep your eye on the man during his short rest but he remains still and makes no other threatening moves.

He's dying, but he seems more curious than anything else. You decide to keep him alive until you can interrogate him properly.
Before you can make a move another man comes into the cave.

He has wild eyes as well and a bloody axe in his hand.
"Who are you lot?" He asks.
"Newcomers." You say. "We're eating them."
"For how long?"

"Until we ask them some questions, then they die."
"What are you?" The man asks again. "I've never seen someone like you.

I have to ask."
"What's it to you?" You ask. "I'm a new comer, that's what."

"I'm an Elemoss, and you are?" He asks, pointing his spear at you.
"A stand user" You say.
"We've come here to ask you some questions and then eat you, if you don't answer.

Who are the 'Oldies'?"
"Well, if you want to know the honest to god truth, I don't know. I just know we're older than you guys.
We're the only ones here, so you must be newer than us, which means you must be the 'Oldies' they spoke of.

We're the 'Elders'."
You have little idea of what he's speaking about, but this man seems friendly enough. You decide to trust him.
"Alright then, 'Elder'.

What do you want to ask, and why does everyone keep calling me a cannibal?"
"I want to know why you're eating people."
"I'm not. I was going to let them go."

"Let them go? Then why are you eating their remains?"
You weigh up your options.

It would be best to get this man out of here, before more of his people come. Instead of answering though, you just repeat your question.
"What do you want to ask?
I'll do my best to answer."

The man says.
Suddenly, you hear a howl. You turn around and see a pack of station guards coming towards you.

The man leaps up and pulls you into a sprint, straight up the mountain.
"What's going on?

Who are you?" He asks. "You work for the government?"
"No!" You shout. "I swear to god, I'm just here to..."
"Shut up and run!
They're firing at us!
I have to get back to the camp!
They'll be coming for you too!
You have to run!
> You say "No"
"No? But...

But I was just..."
"Sorry. I can't risk trusting someone when there's no proof of their existence. The people who matter don't die in moments, you know.
You've got time to think about it, but I suggest you run.
Think about what I said.
> You say "No"
"No?" He says, surprised.

"Then what did you want?"
"I wanted to know why you were running.

I've never known anyone who lived in these parts to do so."
"Oh. Well, I'll tell you why. They're after me too. The people that matter.

I'm on the run with them."
"On the run? But why?"
"It's a long story.
And I have to go." He says, looking behind him at the guards who are slowly catching up with him. "We're cutting this close, but we can make it if I race across the next ridge.
You can follow me if you want, or just wait out here for them. You should probably go anyway. They'll be coming for you next. I know this because I've done this dance before.
Good luck.

You have no words. You just watch as he runs away from you, out of reach.
You sit down on a rock and try to think. The station guards show up later that afternoon.

"You're the man from the mountain aren't you?" One of them says.
"I am.

You're the men sent to protect me while I work." You respond.
"We're doing our job, aren't we? What are you working on?"
"The cave, of course."

You say.
"What? Oh, you mean the shelter?"
"That's the word I'd use for it.

It's more of a... hole really. But I'm fine."
"Uh huh, you don't need protecting.

You need fixing."
"No, I don't. I'm not hurt."
"Yeah? Well what about that guy who was here a few days ago?"
You pause.

"Yeah, we were told he was a sadistic monster who hurt you."
You sigh.
"Guys, I gave a statement about what happened. You didn't need to come if it wasn't necessary. Now would you mind leaving? I'm trying to work.

They leave, but are at the door before you can really get mad.
You swear to god, if you're going to have to put up with this...!
The guards at the station were fine. More than fine. They were almost excessively nice. How the hell can you tell which is real and which is a act?

If you're going to have to deal with these people, you're going to have to stick it out. You still aren't sure about all this though.
Two guards enter as you're thinking.

One of them is the same as before, the other one you don't recognize.
"Hey, I'm Zzz... Zzzz...

What's your name?" He says, before pausing. "What's that you're wearing? You have a hole in your shirt the size of California."
"It's a...
hole? Oh wait, I see, it's from when they dragged me out of the cave. I think I lost a bit of blood. My name's Quintus.
This is my home." You look over at him, and realize he's about your age, or as near as makes no difference.
"Oh, you're the man who died in the cave. Apologies.

I didn't realize you had just woken up. You look a lot worse than when I first met your guards."
"So they told me. So why am I here?"

"As I said, to stay alive. And to work."
"Work? So I can eat?

I'm not a beast you can put in a pit and fatten up for slaughter."
"No, you idiot. Work to keep you alive so you may continue to do awesome things for the kingdom.

You saved the life of a prince. Who knows what might have happened if you hadn't shown up when you did?"
"Oh. Right. Okay, well I'm not going to let the same thing happen here.

I'm going back to sleep."
"Sleep? But you just woke up!"
"Yeah, and I need sleep. If I stay awake, I'm still not fully awake and could have nightmares.

Then where would I be?"
Quintus looks at the other guard, then back to you.
"I guess that makes sense." He says, opening the door wider. "
We'll wake you in 4 hours. And no, you can't sleep here. We need the bed.

It's bad for our health to nap."
"You sure you don't want some of my blood?" You say, going into your tent.
He makes an odd growling sound.
"I heard that!

You're dead!" He says.
You ignore him and lay down, before drifting off into a deep sleep...
"Hello.

Do you like the office?"
"That's not a question." You say.
"I know. It's a rhetorical question. I also know you chose to come here, so I will ask you another.

Do you like the office you're currently in?"
"I'd prefer to say I'm content. I left the cave."
"Ah, a double negative. Interesting. That means either yes or no, right?

But basically yes, right?"
"Basically."
"I have a very limited understanding of human language. I can only properly understand questions and answers that directly relate to me.

All of the ones we've spoken so far have been useless. So I'll ask again. Do you like the office you're currently in?"
"No."
"Interesting. I don't understand that answer.
I was hoping you were either going to say yes or no. I was hoping for a more straightforward answer. If yes, then we already know where your allegiances lie, unless you have more than one office.
But if you say no, then that means you either don't like it where you are or you don't like the person in charge. I can't tell based on the office you're in.
> You say "The World"

"The World" bellows as it's metaphorical arms flex, almost crushing you in it's hands.
"I've heard of this office before, in fact I've heard of you."

"Oh?"
"Yes. You're the man who killed DIO."
You breathe a sigh of relief, thinking that you've gotten away without a scratch.

"Do you think that you're DIO?"
"I'd like to think I'm his equal. Or better."
"Better. Interesting choice of words. Do you have any specific reason for that?"

"I was better than him in everyway."
"Hmm..."
"What does that mean for me?"
"Nothing. But what does that have to do with being DIO?

"Because I want to be better than him."
The World stops moving and looks directly at you.
"Interesting."
For the first time, you get a good look at The World.
Now that you've stopped The World from crushing you earlier, you notice that it's a pitiful looking creature.
It's almost more like a ball than a creature. In the middle of it's pitiful looking body is a black dot, which is most likely it's "heart".
It seems to be staring at you, almost hypnotically. "It's so quiet in here. Are you sure she's dead?" It asks you in a whispery voice.
"Yes. I'm sure." You respond in a similar manner.

"Do you feel her mind?"
"No...well maybe, but I can't grasp it. It's too weak.

I can feel the minds of other humans easily, but this one is so weak."
"Hmm, I see.

Well, you certainly are powerful. If you weren't, I wouldn't have met you and we'd never have this interesting talk."
"Interesting?" You frown. "

What's so interesting about other people's deaths? You saw Dio die. Did you think it was anything but boring?"
"One might think that, however some sort of spark is always there.

It could be considered interesting that you managed to kill him."
"I killed a god. I would've thought that would be more interesting than a petty mortal killing a fellow mortal.

The latter would've been surprising to no end, but not interesting."
"You didn't just kill him. You destroyed his empire in the process. That was probably as big a feat as killing Dio.

You also prevented a bunch of potentially hostile deities from wrecking the place. You have to be counting that as interesting."
"The Empire was a dying animal and I didn't save the girl by killing the prey.

It was all just a pointless waste of time."
"Then why did you do it?"
"...because I wanted to see him suffer." The World seems to ponder your response. "You are interesting my boy.

You're the first one I've talked to in a long time that's actually been interesting enough to converse with."
"I'm not your boy. I'm not your anything."
"True.

You don't know or care to know how old you are, do you?"
"I'm twenty one."
"Ah, I suppose you do know that much... okay, so you're an eternal.

I can sense that much thanks to your strong mental presence. You've probably lived for thousands of years, at this point. What I'm getting from you is that you don't want to tell me anything about yourself.

Am I wrong?"
"Just because I don't talk about my past doesn't mean I'm hiding anything."
"Really? Why have you never joined a religion? You're very powerful.

I can sense that. You'd be a great asset to the Temple of Fel. Why have you chosen to keep yourself isolated?"
"Because I didn't want to be bothered."
"Bother?

Really? That's rather funny considering that your whole life is a bother."
"My whole life? You don't know anything about-"
"I know you want to kill Dario. That's obvious.
You're a lot stronger than when we last met and you've been holding back, which is good. That means you're still not an outright murderer. You want to so bad though. I can tell.

I know the type really. Once they get that burning desire, nothing can stop them. Not even death."
"I'm not going to kill him," You snap.

"You didn't kill Dario?"
"I killed his top lieutenant though.

Don't worry, I'm still going to kill the Emperor. I'm just having a little fun getting stronger in the meantime."
"You should join me then. I can get you close to him."
"Get me close?

What, are you going to drug me or something?"
"No, you idiot. I'm suggesting that you actually work for me.

I could use an extra hand. Then when the Emperor is dead, you can go on with your plan."
"That's really not going to work out for me."
"Why not?
You're already hiding who you are and working undercover. I'm sure if you explained your situation, and showed us what skills you actually have, we could easily work out a deal for you."

"Trust me, it isn't a good idea."
"You seem very sure about that."
"I really am. Just leave me alone.

I'm good."
"I don't think I will. I know enough about you that you won't stop until you've killed the both of us, yourself and the Emperor included.

And even then, I'm not convinced you'll stop until you've taken everything not nailed down in that castle."
You don't respond.
"Your silence confirms my suspicions.

You really aren't interested are you?"
"I said I'm fine."
"No, you actually said 'It ain't good'."
"What?"
"You said, 'It ain't good'.

I think you know what I'm talking about."
"Oh that. Yes, it's true. I won't get good until the Emperor is dead."
"Good? Is that what you call it now?
Look, I don't care if you're happy with your lot in life. I'm not judging you. But I am saying that perhaps you should look at other opportunities.

You're young and you're not even alive. What the hell kind of life is that?"
"The only one I know," You say with a shrug.
"Are you really sure about that?
Think hard. If you were in my position, as I have often pondered in the past, I might very well have taken the same decision. It was a good enough decision at the time given the circumstances.

But now, thinking back, I wonder if I shouldn't have done something else."
"So what did you do?"
"I joined the Church.
> You say "Well lets kill the Emperor"
You figure you can narrow it down to one of three choices. The first is that he's trying to play mind games with you. The second is that he really is dead set on self destruction.

The third possibility, and probably the right one, is that he's just madly insane. You decide to throw caution to the wind and play his game.
"Well, lets kill the Emperor"
The man's eyes light up.

"Indeed! Let's do that then!"
The cloaked man pulls back his hood revealing a youthful yet scarred face. His eyes however still hide all.
"My name is Cal. What should I call you?"

"You can call me... By my new name if you like." You reply.
"I'm sure that I will, but isn't it Unworthy?

"Unworthy...yeah. Call me that if you like."
"Sure. You don't have a nickname then?"
"Me? No."
"How about a first name then?

Do you have one?"
"I don't know."
"You don't have a name?"
"Not really."

"Well, what would you like me to call you?"
"You can call me. I don't care."
"Alright then, you can call me whatever you like."

Cal nods.
"So Unworthy, are you new to all this?" Cal asks.
"I'm still developing my abilities. It takes me awhile to master them at this level."
Cal nods.
You can tell he knows he's talking too much, but can't stop himself. You've dealt with loquacious individuals like this before and know the best way to deal with it is to change the subject.
"Anyway, you were saying? You wanted to kill the Emperor, what's wrong with the Empire?

"Everything!" Cal exclaims. You give him a look to which he replies with another question.
"So what's your opinion on the Emperor?"
"He's an idiot.

I don't understand why he can't just leave and let the rest of us be in peace. He's cost me a friend and a lover just for one example."
"Who? The Emperor or Ragnor?
I know about Ragnor. I absolutely loathed that man. He was an unhelpful jack***** who deserved every horrible thing that happened to him. I'm not even ashamed to admit it."

"You may speak freely." You reply.
Cal smiles a bit.
"I see. You're not from the Empire are you?" Cal asks.
"How could you tell?

It's quite evident that I'm currently hiding in your house and Ragnor's house is in complete ruins after the events that occurred three years ago and I'm not exactly in good terms with the Emperor, who would've

thought that?"
"True, but there's still so much the two of you do that we don't. For one thing there is no denying that you are working with Ragnor.

You know something isn't right about that?"
"Well, I'm not saying much. Also it's not like I have a choice. If I say anything he'll kill me."

"So, why are you even helping him."
"He saved my life! He's the only person who has shown any kindness to me. I have no reason to not help him.
He's trying to find a way to defeat the Emperor and get us all freedom. That's the goal isn't it?"
Cal thinks for a moment.

undoneWindow.text:
But why would he say such a thing? He asked to be let go, didn't he?"
"They're lying! We would never lie!

"No?" The man says. "You just want me to leave you and my fellows to die? Why would you do such a thing, when you can help us?"
"I'm not working for the government!"

"I am Brother Gannon, and this is my home."
Brother Gannon holds up a hand to stop any protests you might make.

"Before you ask, I'm not a member of the Eternals, if that's what you're worried about."
You have nothing to say and he continues his story.

title: Eat The Cursed Coin + watch Pewds + Praise The Godess + Elvish Stuff

worldInfo.entry: Eric Andre is a chaotic comedian who uses surreal skits and shock humor.
The Eric Andre Show is a chaotic talk show where random things happen and nothing makes sense. Guests are often made to feel uncomfortable.
Hannibal Buress is a chill guy who is always stoned and likes to criticize the show. He stands behind the chair.
The band plays random and discordant music.
Random people and celebrity imposters appear from behind the curtains, do random things, and leave just as quickly.

actions.text:
You are a guest on the Eric Andre Show. As you walk into the set, Eric Andre is eating his desk while howling in a feral manner.
The band plays a chaotic, discordant tune.
Hannibal Buress stands behind the chair, looking really stoned.

He doesn't move, but breaks into the occasional sweat and wipes his forehead.
Eric Andre rapidly types on the keyboard.
Random people appear on the desk, within the desk, and behind the desk.
The people do random activities such as juggle, dance, and ride a unicycle while the desk becomes a children's playground.
> You do something random.

You decide to juggle eggs while the desk becomes a children's playground.
You juggle eggs while the desk becomes a children's playground. The audience appears to consist entirely of dead children.
You juggle eggs while the desk becomes a children's playground. A large, pale child sits in the corner of the room, looking at you with severe disapproval.
> You say "What is it mortal"

You say "What is it, mortal?"
The pale child growls.
You say "What did you say?"
The pale child begins growling at a much louder volume.
> You say "Growl this"

You say "Growl this"
The child disappears, and loud screaming is heard throughout the studio.
You sit down with Eric and begin drinking heavily.
You feel sick and tired.

It is 3:30am.
Eric begins spouting out random facts and numbers to you.
There is a knock at the door.
Eric asks you who is it.

You reply "No one".
The knocking continues, and Eric gets up to answer it.
Huge amounts of awkward silence follow.

A man in a red robe and a wizard's hat stands in the doorway.
He begins talking rapidly.
He is speaking Occidental.
> You say "Is math related to sciencie"

You say "Is math related to science", in accented American English.
The man pauses, before replying "Yes". He continues speaking.

He is speaking American English.
The man says "Your question was: Is math related to science?"
You reply "Yes".
The man says "In that case, you may enter the inner sanctum."

Hazel sits down with you and pours you a drink, which youDown in one.
You are still a bit drunk, but in a good way.

You have a pleasant feeling in your stomach, and your brain begins working normally.
The man behind the red robe begins speaking.
He says "I am the devil."

You reply "I have long believed in the existence of the devil, but are you God?"
The man replies "Of course I am, what kind of question is that for a question."

He begins questioning you about your childhood, recent life, and views on religion.
During the course of this questioning, he asks you "Who are you, and what do you do?
> You say "Mu name is Annie the orphan, you killed my father prepare yourself to die"
You say "My name is Annie, you killed my father, prepare yourself to die.

The devil laughs in your face.
The devil laughs in your face.
He laughs for a long time.

The laughter echoes throughout your skull.
Eventually, the laughing stops.
He asks "Are you Annie?"
You reply with a chuckle and shake of the head "No."

The devil smiles "Is your name Ann-nnie?"
You laugh and nod your head "Yes."
The devil nods as well "I don't think we'll be getting along, then"

You nod in return "I don't think so too."
The devil hums a tune and begins to leave when he stops "Have you ever considered the possibility that I'm actually a really bad guy?"
> You say "Whaaaat!A devil bad, who would have known"

You say "Whaaaat!A devil bad, who would have known".
The devil pauses and looks at you "I do a lot of bad things."
You shrug in response "Lots of people do"
The devil smirks "Really? Lots of people kill their parents and have corn?
> You say "I like corn"

You say "I like corn".
The devil bursts into laughter again "You like corn? Hahaha, you're a real moron aren't you?

Of course you like corn, it keeps you alive to feed it to your pet"
He bursts out of the room, leaving you in silence.
It's at this moment, you decide he's gone too far "
Hey wait!

Don't I have the right to love corn as well?"
After a moment of silence, you begin to feel afraid, the devil has left "
> You say "So"

You say "So".
The silence is broken by the sound of a whip cracking. The sound is so loud that you jump and fall to the ground.
> You say "I like were this is going"

You say "I like were this is going".
The sound of the whip crack is once again heard "I'm the devil, and you have my permission to die."
At this point you shut up.
The whipping continues for quite a while, before finally stopping.
A whisper comes from down the room "You have my permission to live."
> You say "That was a quick change"

You say "That was a quick change".
A laugh echoes down the room "It's been my experience, sometimes people need a quick shock to snap them out of their illusions.
I don't think you're one of those people.

I was hoping you'd last longer, but your lack of fight and determination had me change my mind."
The devil begins walking down the room towards you "You have some interesting questions.

Let's discuss them."
You feel a bit safer "What are we going to discuss?"
The devil smiles "That is up to you, I can give you knowledge or access to secrets. Which would you prefer?
And it must be an adult choice, no turning back.
> You say "Dont you devils always use contracts and stuff"
You say "Dont you devils always use contracts".

The devil stops and looks at you "There isn't any contract!"
You panic a little "Well then, what is this?
The devil smiles "This is my deal with you, give me your decision and your life."
> You say "Thats not veru devil-like of you"
You say "That's not very devil-like of you".
The devil looks confused for a second "What do you mean?

Isn't a deal what you are is it not?
You think for a second "Well, sort of....but you are allowing me to go on living rather than taking it, so isn't that a deal?"
> You say "Wait what are you!?"

You say "Wait what are you?".
The devil looks at you confused for a second "What? What am I?

You panic a little "What are you then?"
The devil gets very close to your face "I'm a man."
You gasp "You can't be! No one can be a man!"

The devil raises his eyebrow "Why not? What are you a boy?"
You blush a bit "Well no, but everyone agrees that men are more valid than boys!"

You hear chuckles in the background and the devil go silent "So what are you?"
You explain your point of view, the devil listens intently without interrupting.
The devil smiles "Interesting. It seems you are not ready to make a deal just yet, but that's fine. I can wait.

Tell you what, why don't I give you a small gift to get you started? Something you can keep and remind you of our deal.
You don't really have much to choose from, so you agree.

The devil disappears for a second, before reappearing, he throws a goldenen coin on the ground in front of you "There. Now pick it up."
You do so "Why?"

The devil gives you a Mischievous grin "Just do it."
You pick up the coin "What should I do?"
The devil reaches out his hand "Give it to me."
> You say "This is cursed isn it"

You say "This is cursed isn't it".
The devil frowns a bit "What? No it's not. Now give it here.
> You say "You want me to beliebe that you are giving me a coin for no reason"
You say "You want me to beliebe that you are giving me a coin for no reason".
The devil frowns "Of course I'm doing it for a reason! I just haven't told you yet what it is.

You're so suspicious all the time. If I actually wanted to curse you, I wouldn't have given you the coin. I'd make you pick it up."
You look at the coin for a second "

You're lying!"
The devil laugh a bit "Why would I lie about something so silly? Now give me the coin."
You hand over the coin "

I'm not giving it to you!"
The devil gets very close to your face "Tch. If you actually trusted me, you'd give me the coin already.
> You eat the coin.

You eat the coin and put your hand forward.
The devil grabs your wrist and you feel an unnatural chill run through your body.

His eyes turn red as he growls.
"What the hell, man! I just gave you a gift! I don't want to be cheated!"
You pull your wrist out of the devils grip and put your hand on the spot where his hand was a second ago.

The devil looks away "Fine with me."
You feel nothing. Confused, you check the coin.
It appears that nothing happened.

Confused, you turn around and head back to the bed room.
When you reach the bedroom, you put the coin in your pocket without checking what exactly it is.

You don't feel anything different, but you're expecting something bad to happen any moment now...
Nothing happens.
Feeling a little relieved, you go back to your room and fall asleep.

In the morning, you put the coin under your pillow "Just in case".
Later that day, you feel a sudden pain in your Back "Agh!", you scream as you fall from your bed.

You look at your body and notice that it has aged rapidly. In fact, you now look so old that you don't recognize yourself.
"What the hell am I doing here?!!"
> You watch youtube.

"What the hell am I doing here?!!"
You start watching Youtube in order to see if maybe you can find some kind of way out of this nightmare.
> You watch pewdiepie.

You search for "pewdiepie" and stumble upon a video of him talking.
A happy voice is speaking Spanish "Hola!". You recognize that voice. It's the devil.
> You porque estas hablando español.
You listen to the devil "Porque estas hablando español? I thought you were an American.

What's up with that?"
"Nevermind, what are you doing here?"
"I'm talking to you, freak. And you, out of curiosity, why are you here?

You ignore him "I'm here to watch pewdiepie..."
Pewdiepie walks on-screen and greets the audience...

"What is happening to me?"
"I don't like his attitude." The devil whispers in your ear. "I wouldn't piss on him if he was on fire."
"He's performing?

I always wanted to see him perform!"
You hear a chuckle in your ear "Nice to see that you have tastes, at least.

Anyway, he's not really performing. This is just an act. He's doing a doc-u..."
"Don't tell me anything else! If I hear his voice one more time, I'll go insane!

Him, thousands of screaming fans and a big screen! He's a one man band!" You notice that you are now yelling.
"Well, that one man is your boyfriend.

You love him, right?"
You go to the bathroom and throw up...
"So, why are you here?"
You dry heave "I..."
Your phone starts ringing "Is that thing still allowed?

?" You groan and go to the living room.
Pewdiepie can be heard scream, "Shut up!" in an angry tone before answering the phone "Hello?

?"
"Hey, pewdiepie." You recognize the voice as devil's.
"What do you want?"
"Just a chat. That's all. You have nothing to fear from me."
"I don't know why you're doing this. But, I can tell you have a deep seeded hatred for another one of my acquaintances. Tell him to look behind him."
> You say "Ho, btw do you know a demon named Azizzella"

He blushes "Ah, no. Should I?"
"He thinks you do and he wants to know if you do.

I think he wants to kill you, but for some reason he wants to know if you really are a demon."
"Well....(Sigh) I can't tell you not to cling to him.

But if it will set your mind at ease, then no, I do not have any such acquaintance."
You get a call from your mother. She wants to know if you want to come over for dinner "

It's my dad's birthday and the entire family is getting together to celebrate. There will be a lot of people there, so it would be pretty hard for you to kill me there."
You think about it. "

Fine, I'll come."
"See you then!
By the way, you can bring a friend!
> You say "I dont have friends thats why Im talking to a devil"

He laughs. "Well, I don't have any friends either, but I'm sure we can find some. Do you know how to dance?"
"No."
"Alright, well, the first step is to find a partner. If you want, I can teach you.

It's pretty easy, just try not to step on my feet."
"I don't think I'll need help with that.

What's your name?"
"It's Frank."
You look at him "This is the best thing that's happened to me today.
I'm going to go to this party, with my new partner, who I'll teach how to dance. And it's a Saturday! So i won't have to go to work on a Saturday!
This is awesome!

You should be happy too!"
"I sure am! Thank you for this!
I'm glad you decided to come to the party with me! Oh, there's a -39°C wind blowing, so please don't wear very much.

If you get too cold, just come and sit on my lap until the wind stops blowing."
"Hmm, well I don't know..."
"Hey, if you don't want to, that's fine!

We can both just stay here, but I thought we could go together! Come on, let's go!"
You're not sure about this, but you don't want to disappoint Frank, so "

Sure."
He takes your hand and carries you into the street "Wow, it's really cold. I think the temperature dropped -25°C in just the few minutes it took us to get here.

Are you fine? I can go faster if you're not used to the cold."
"No! Please don't! I'm used to the cold!" You start to get dizzy.
He laughs "Alright, alright, we're here!
Don't worry, I know a place that's a little warmer, come on!
He leads you into a house, and immediately you feel warmer inside. A roaring fire is in the fireplace, and there are plenty of comfortable looking chairs to sit in around it.

A large man hunched forward in a chair by the fire grabs your other hand and smiles at you "Hey there, youngster. Come to play?"
"Play?" You look at Frank.
He shrugs, and the large man takes you by the hand and pulls you towards a spinning wheel and some other toys on a table "Go on, play! I'll watch outnuh-oard for you."
> You say "I wil pass"
You say you won't play. The large man frowns "Alright then, what can I get for ya?"
You look at Frank. He says "Whatever you've got.

We're just looking."
The large man gives you a strange look, but heads to the fridge. He opens it, then stares at you "Well... I got some orange juice, milk, water, and beer.

Which one's ith'le ya fancy?"
"Erm... water, please.

Thank you."
The large man heads to the fridge, grabs a two-liter bottle of water, and twists the cap off. He hands it to you, and you gulp it down.
It's so cold, that you can feel the goosebumps rise up all over your body. At first the coldness is refreshing, but after a few seconds, it starts to bother you.
"Are you sure? That's ith'le all you want. We got some great beer and root beer in thif place.
Orif you want, I can get you a bowl of chili or something thith much hotter. Or, you could just come with me to my place and we can hot-tub ith'!"

"I'm really fine. Thank you for the water, though." You feel the need to say something polite.
"Alright then. Come on, let's go."

The large man grabs your hand and pulls you towards the door.
"Wha... where are we going?" You ask, panic rising inside you.
"To my place."

You pull your hand back "I don't want to go there!"
"Yoo-hoo, Frank!" A voice calls from behind the curtain.

"Are we ready?"
"Yeah, just let me throw on a t-shirt and my boots!" Frank calls back.

"I'll warm up the car!" The voice answers.
Frank turns to you "Come on, let's go." He opens the front door and pulls you through it.

Before you leave, you look back at the house. The large man leans against a wall, looking at you. He raises his eyebrow at you and starts walking towards you.
You turn around, and run.
You run for a few seconds, then Frank pulls you to a stop. "What the hell's wrong with you, man? I haven't seen you this scared since we were six.

Are you really that uncomfortable around large men?"
You look at him, then over to the large man. He shrugs, and takes you by the hand. "Let's go, kid.
I'll warm you up to him.
> You say "Retreat"

You turn to run, but Frank grabs your shoulder. "Hey, why are you running now? Seriously, I thought you were ready for this."
"I'm not! The large man just intimidated me!"
> You flee.
You turn and run, hurrying out of the living room and into the foyer.

You slip, though, and land on your knees. Frank rushes over to help, but you quickly scramble up and continue running towards the front door.
"Jesus Christ, kid. What's with the panic?

You need to relax. I told you, all you need to do is talk to the large man."
"I can do that! But...
> You get the fuck put of there.

You turn, and see the large man walking towards you. You take off, but Frank grabs your hand.
"Don't worry, man. I'll get you out of here."
He opens the door and pulls you outside.

He shuts the door, and you hear a loud click as the lock slides into place.
"Let's go, kid."
You and Frank walk for a minute before you turn to him.

"Frank, who the hell is that guy?"
"What, you mean John?"
"I dunno. What's his name?"
"John what?"
"John Brown."
You stare at him.
> You say "Narrator tell me the definition of potato"
"He is the main antagonist of the story. You'll meet him soon. He's a huge guy, and has a deep, gruff voice. He's not nice, and he's mean to you."

"Why?"
"Well, that's a story for later. Right now, we have to get you to school."
"Can't you drive me?

I don't want to go to school." You begin sobbing.
"Kid, you've got to go to school. It's the law. C'mon, let's get in the car.
I'll drive you there.
You walk over to the passenger side of the car and get in. Frank drives over to the school, and pulls you out. You walk up to the main school building, and go through the front doors.
After going down a short hall, you reach your first class. Math is on the right. Your teacher, Mr. Fergusson, stands at the front of the room.
> You say "Uhv"

"Alright, let's begin class."

The sorceress and her soldiers left quickly when they heard this.

The other would lead to a bright path, one of kindness, purity, and love.
The old man chose the dark path many times.
He would become more powerful, but lose his soul. The Emperor's sorceress came back, she was looking for him, and found him when he least expected it.

"Because if they send in a lot more people to kill you, then we're going to have a lot of people to defend ourselves."
She thinks for a moment.

"You make a good point. I suppose we could try to fool them somehow."
"Let's just not tell them at all.

undoneWindow.text:
You are an elf. You have always lived here, always fought the humans.
There is no escape, but you can prevent this from ever happening again. This must be contained.

You are in the ruins of an ancient elven city. Decaying statues lay broken and scattered around you. Once a grand city, now just a desolate memory.
The old man steps forward from the broken gates.

You are an elf. You have always lived here, always fought the humans.
There is no escape, but you can prevent this from ever happening again. This must be contained.
You are an elf.

You are an elf. You have always lived here, always fought the humans.
There is no escape, but you can prevent this from ever happening again. This must be contained.
> You say "Wait is he Mediev"

"He is not human."
A young man, barely more than a boy, was running from a pack of werewolves. He couldn't fight them; he didn't have a sword or any sort of weapon.
> You say "Your next spell if a ligthing bolt!"

You are an elf. You have always lived here, always fought the humans.
Your magical powers are growing stronger with each spell you learn.

Suddenly you see her as a child. You see yourself as a child. You are running through the fields and laughing with your friends. Everything is good.
Then everything changes in an instant.

As you run, you notice that you are feeling less and less tired.
You are beginning to feel invigorated rather than exhausted.
The humans seem to be finishing up a meal, which consists of a large slab of meat hanging over a fire. One of the humans spots you, and they all turn to look.

.
The leader kneels down beside you, smiling. "A brave first move. Tell me, who are you?"
You grin, spitting blood out of your mouth.

.
You stand up to face the leader, and he readies his sword.
"I'm not going to beg."
The leader shrugs and lets his sword fall to the ground.

"That will serve as a warning"
The leader nods, then rides his horse back to camp. The knights do not notice you.
Now, the leader is all that is left.

"That will serve as a warning"
The leader draws his sword, and kneels down to cut out your heart.
As he takes it out of his sheath, you whisper "I love you".
May your arrows always hit their mark.

"Get out now, or I will kill the children," the man says.
You stare at him in shock. The humans in the sacred forest...
But you can't risk losing the children.

The river spirit was a blurry, amorphous shape for a few moments, but now it's solid once more.
You walk out of the forest, back onto the road.

The river spirit waves, and fades back into the water.
"Take care," it says.
You continue walking, heading towards Weaver's Barn.

"So can you use these?" you ask.
"I do not know," the river spirit says. "I will have to find out."
"Can you... can you teach me to use this?"
The river spirit appears. "So..." you begin, rather nervously.

"I'm guessing you're the one who moved the humans?"
The spirit smiles at you. "Indeed," it says. "And how do you know that?"
"You... moved the hunters?" you suggest.

"Do you... talk?"
The spirit looks at you. "Not usually," she replies.
> You say "They didnt left, they are in here!"

You walk to the water's edge, staring at the black dot. It's about the size of a small child. It looks like a child...
SloweS youSter

"Hey,"

you say, slowly approaching the object. "Are you... swimming?"
The Object moves, and you're horrified to see a face appear. A horrible, rotten, infection-riddled child's face.

"Hey," Peter says.
"What do you want?" you ask, terrified.
"Nothing. Just dropping by."
"It's not safe out there," another voice says.
> You say "Wait, not this dream again"

"Again?" the other voice asks. "From what I heard, you had far worse than this in the first dream."
"I had a silver dagger!" you protest. "Not a wooden sword!

It's a valuable object!"
"Relax, it was just a dream," Peter says. "So, you want us to help you get out of here? Is that it?
"You said you dreamed about us months ago," Peter says.
You are an elven child, playing in the forest as your parents look on. A large group of orcs appears from the nearby steep hills, marching to the village.

You have lived a long life, and had many children. One day, you will tell them of the deeds of the Godess, so that they may learn.
You died in combat, defending the world from Demons.

"Help! Help!"
You scream. You've been killed by a mortal enemy.

"Praise the Godess, sacrifice and then victory!" the demon says dramatically.
The demon walks into the room, looking back at you and laughing.
"Come on in," he says.
"I don't see why we should just kill him, there's no reason for the humans to die. The undead can easily be dealt with by the normal methods.

You turn to look at the door, to see if the Godess has given you an answer.
"It's not a dream," you think. It's not a dream.

"I'm trying to get our old friend, Azor, to free me from my contract. Are you here to help?"
"No."
"What are you doing here?"
"I got lost."
You stop and stare at her, as Frank is an old boyfriend of yours. He always made them for you when you went out with him, before he went off to colllege.
When you arrive, you tell your mother that you're too tired to go to school, and head upstairs to bed. That night, you have a nightmare about a monster in your closet.

You walk up to one of the demons, and pull out your Walkman.
"What's this?" he asks, snatching it from your hands.
Suddenly, he stops, staring at you.

"Praise the godess," you say.
Suddenly, a white figure manifests in front of you. It's the same girl you saw earlier, the one who is being stalked.

"Praise the godess," you whisper.
The man from earlier appears in front of you.
"Hello," he says, smiling.

"Praise the godess," you say.
He smiles and raises his knife, stabbing you twice in the neck.
You manage to get your knife to his neck, but he wrestles it from you and slams you into the chalkboard. You go flying, smacking your head into the board and falling unconscious.

.
"Oh, do you like playing video games?" she asks.
"Sometimes," you reply.
This girl is soooo boring. Maybe I should end her life... Nah, too much work.
> You say "Oh i see(so uninteresting)"

"Oh yeah? Show me one of those."
You grumble, and pull out your notebook.

"Oh, you're new?" the girl says.
"Yeah," you say.
"I'm Caroline," she says, offering her hand.
You shake her hand, and remember her name.
