description: Are you tired of wanting to play something in Ai Dungeon, but having no idea on what to play? You're tired of looking around explorer, but not finding good scenarios to satisfy your palate? Well, this is your lucky day! With Openai's cutting-edge technology, you'll have an AI that will create the scenario you want, all you have to do is put the tags of what you want!
memory:
This AI will create a setting based on the tags you put in.

Tags: school

Setting:

Tags: fantasy, alien, corruption, medieval
Setting: This is a fantasy world like any other, with elves, dwarfs, etc. However, an alien invasion from another dimension has invaded this world, corrupting everything at your step. It is the Storm, the red plague.

actions.text:
Tags: School

Setting:
The main character is a bored student who one day decides to hack his school's computer system and make it a little more interesting.

He ends up deleting all the personal information of the school, as well as gaining remote access. He then makes the grade and sporting events only games, causing injuries and any important information to be deleted.
> You say "So"

You create a system to say you created the school. Everyone starts as the main character.
You walk into your new high school, your former school being torn down and replaced.
The halls are empty, most students having already gotten their schedules. You walk up to the main office and wait in line. When you get to the front, you tell the lady that you want your schedule.
She tells you that you don't just get the main one. You have to make a small card explaining where you would like to be sitting, and if it doesn't already fit you can request to have it changed.
You make your card, and she gives it to you. You walk to your classes, which all look interesting to you. Your first period is Math, which you have no problems with.
Lunch is at noon, and you go to the cafeteria and sit by yourself. You look over your notes for History of the Video Game.

During lunch, you go up to a girl and start a conversation.
You: Hey, do you go here?
Her: Yeah, I'm in your English class.
You: I have no friends.

Do you want to sit with me?
Her: (Thinking) Yeah, I guess.
You: Come on, we'll find a table over here.
You pull out a chair for her.
She sits down, and you tell her what your schedule is. She shows an interest in the table, and you explain that it's where you're all going to meet to go to the football game.
You both finish eating, and you walk to your next class, Music. It's a small class, but the teacher still manages to involve the students.
You finish your first period, pause to look for your next locker, and then head to lunch. There, you sit alone and eat a sandwich, looking for the girl.
She's not there, and you put your tray on the floor to stop anyone from knocking your food off.

After five minutes, you give up and walk to your next class, which is History. It's the least favorite class of yours, mainly because the teacher is so dry and boring and also because it focuses on the Storm.
You glance at the board and see that today is October 27th, the annual Town of Departed Souls Day. You learned about it in History, which only focused on ghosts.

You sit down, hearing the usual "Hello, how are you," and such. The girl to your right answers first, like it's some sort of competition.
Her: I'm good, and you?
> You say "Oh is that a challenge?"

You glare at her. She looks back, surprised.
You: There's a staring competition?
Her: No, I just....argh! You're so weird!
You: Hmm, yeah sure.
She gives up and tries to make conversation instead, but you have no clue what she's going on about. You zone her out and listen to the teacher, who is talking about the history behind it.
> You say "Teacher, is math related to sciencie?"

The teacher, who is an older man with a big nose, looks at you.
Teacher: Math? Oh, no. No, I don't thi......Ackerson, pay attention!
You looked away from the teacher and over at the girl to your right. She was trying to make eye contact with you, but you were still too busy staring at the teacher.

You: Math is a science
Teacher: What?
You: I said math is a science
Teacher: Oh no, Satan's spawn has arrived.

You: I'm not Satan, I'm Ackerson.
Teacher: You're not what?
You: I'm Ackerson.
The teacher turns to look at you.

Teacher: Ackerson, is that right?
You: Yes.
Teacher: Pleased to meet you, Ackerson. I'm Mr. Harlow. Now, where were we...
no, no, look, I was teaching you that history is often intertwined with math and science. Take the atomic bomb for example.
Rutherford and his team at the atom found out how to split the atom with the help of history. Without history, who would've known how to split the atom?

You: Yeah, but the atomic bomb is a bad example.
Mr. Harlow: Maybe, but that's because you're too young to appreciate history.

When you grow older, you'll understand exactly what I'm talking about.
You: Yeah, sure.
Mr.

Harlow: Anyway, now that we got the history lesson out of the way, we can get to more fun things. Like math.
You: Math is fun?

Mr. Harlow: Math is wonderful. I love math. It's one of the few things that keeps me from going completely insane.
You: How can something be insane and inane at the same time?
Mr. Harlow: It isn't easy, well maybe it is for me, but you'll figure it out eventually.

Anyway, I'm going to give you an addition problem.
He turns to the board and begins to write on it.
Mr. Harlow: Add these numbers together.
You look at the numbers he wrote.

You: 23+12=37
Mr. Harlow: Good, now how would you do it with just addition?
You: One more.
Mr. Harlow: Okay, what is it?

You: 9+8
Mr. Harlow: Yes, and I want you to think about why you got that answer... no wait, don't think. Just feel.

You: Oh, I feel like that's wrong. I can't just feel. I have to think about it.
Mr. Harlow: No, no, those are your feelings.

Your brain is just recording them for you, so you don't have to keep track and remember everything.
You: Oh.
Mr. Harlow: What was the first number?
You: 23
Mr.

Harlow: Yes, that's your base number. It's always there whether you're thinking about it or not, but if you're thinking about it, you can do better.
He writes something on the board.

Mr. Harlow: Now, add these two numbers together and see what you get.
You look at the numbers and perform the addition.
You: 40
Mr. Harlow: Excellent!

You're starting to get a feel for it. You can even try the problem again, and get the same answer.
He turns to leave, then turns around.
Mr.

Harlow: I'd like to point out that you didn't need to memorize the numbers, you just needed to add them together in your head.
You: ... No I didn't.
Mr.
Harlow: Yes you did. You're lying to yourself if you say you didn't. Don't worry, nobody else will be able to tell. Now get out of my classroom.

You walk out of the class and head to the nurse's office.
You: I feel like I'm going insane.

Nurse: Oh, you just had a panic attack in class. I've seen that before.
You: No, it... I don't think I'm going insane. I'm not making things up.
> You say "I will take a short nap"

Nurse: Take a nap?
You: Yeah. Just for a few minutes.
Nurse: Okay, but don't die in the process.

You fall into unconsciousness.
You: AAAAAAAHHHHHHHHHH!!!!!!!!!
You snap awake, and are back in the nurse's office. You notice your watch has stopped completely.
> You check other beds.

All the other beds in the room are empty, and your friends are nowhere to be found.
You: Where are everyone?
Nurse: You're the only one that took a nap here.

You: What... The...
Nurse: You had a panic attack in class, and then fainted in my office.
You: How long was I out?

Nurse: The school day ends at noon on Fridays, so you've been asleep for most of the day.
You: Oh. Okay.

Nurse: Do you feel up to questioning me?
You: Hmm?
Nurse: I said, do you feel up to questioning me?
You: Yeah, I'm fine.

Nurse: Okay then.
You: (sarcastic) Thanks.
Nurse: So do you have any questions for me?
> You say "Whats your bra size?"

You: What's your bra size?
The nurse smiles a bit.
Nurse: Haha, do I look like a girl that knows something like that?
> You say "I will asume a C then"
Nurse: Okay, well if you think a C is good, then I'm a D...

and maybe a DD.
You: That's not helping!
Nurse: I can let you go home if you want me too...
You: What? No! What kind of question is that?

Nurse: You want me to go down on you don't you?
You: No!
Nurse: Are you sure?
You: Yes!

Nurse: Are you sure?
You: Yes!
Nurse: Maybe we should just skip the foreplay.
You: What? No!

Nurse: Okay, I'll go get the doctor.
Suddenly, the doctor walks into the room.
Doctor: What the hell is going on in here?
You: Uh...

this is my friend. He just fainted and I was asking you about your...
Doctor: My bra size? Don't you have anything better to ask me, how about something medical for a change?

You: (Sarcastic) No, sorry.
Doctor: (Sarcastic) I see... I'll be in my office, come get me if anything comes up.

You: Bye.
Doctor: (Sarcastic) Bye.
You walk out of the office as the doctor slams the door, leaving you standing there.
What the hell just happened?

You walk into your home, and find your mom making your dad's lunch.
You: Hi.
Mom: Hey kid, your father is out at work so I'm making your lunch.

You: Thanks
You sit down to eat lunch, and ponder what could've happened that would've caused you to faint. Your mom notices you're quiet and worried, so she asks what's wrong.

You: I fainted in school again.
Mom: Oh no! Are you alright?
You: Yeah, I'm fine now that I'm home.
Mom: You seem worried though.

You: Well, it's sort of a long story.
Mom: I've got time.
You: Well, part of the reason I fainted was because the school nurse...

Mom: WAIT.
You: What?
Mom: You were having a conversation with her that you should go down on her?
You: (Sarcastic) Yeah, something like that...
Mom: (Sarcastic) Geez, you really do pick 'em weird.

You: (Sarcastic) You don't know the half of it...
As you tell the rest of the story, your mom covers her mouth in surprise.

Mom: My, my, my... looks like you hit it hard today.
You: What?
Mom: You were asking this nurse that question?
You: Yeah, what of it?

Mom: Well, back in my day, girls would faint for a guy if he asked them that!
You: You're joking.

Mom: No, I'm serious. Especially if that guy was cute like you.
You: What?!
Mom: Couples back in the old days would go out in public and show affection.

It wasn't as if they hid it like nowadays.
You: That's... just weird.
Mom: True, but not everyone was a Puritan back then.

You: Yeah, like future presidents Reagan and Nixon.
Mom: Oh, they weren't married?
You: No. They were just really good friends.
Mom: Huh.

I would've figured they would've been.
You: Yeah, well they weren't.
Mom: So wait, how'd they show affection?
You: Meh, I don't care to explain that one.

Mom: Too bad. It would've been a interesting to see first hand.
You: Yeah, well I'm done with that stuff.
Mom: You sure? Seems like you'd want to know.

You: Nah, I'm good.
Mom: You sure? Seems like you'd want to know.
You: Nah, I'm good.
Mom: You sure?

Seems like you'd want to know.
You: (Sigh) Yeah, alright! I want to know EVERYTHING about this!
Mom: Alright! Alright! Relax!

It's actually quite simple.
The pair of you sit on your bed while your mom explains the process of how it's done. It's really simple, really.
First you just say "Let's have fun," and the girl's heart beats faster. Then, you say whatever you want to do. If the girl likes it, she'll agree.
If not, she'll refuse.
If she refuses, you stop and say, "We should stop having fun." If she agrees, great! Then you do it again. You do this until you have a long list of things to do together.
Mom: There are different types of fun too. You can make them do athletic activities like dancing or jumping or even... kissing.

Other types of fun include doing homework, watching scary movies, and even cooking. The list goes on and on.
You: Cook?
Mom: Yep. You know how I know you like Asian food?

You: Um... because I order it almost every night at the inn.
Mom: Yeah, but you've never made it yourself?
You: (Sigh) No.

Mom: Well, whenever you're making fun plans, just remember that cooking is also fun. You can make every girl happy by cooking for them.
You: Okay I will!
Mom: You better!
After you and your mom agree to your terms, you head back to school. And as per usual, you find yourself sitting alone. Lunch passes by slowly, as do most of your classes.

Finally, the final bell ends class, and you're free until lunch.
You wander down the empty halls, deep in thought. What should you do for fun? What can you do that'd make every girl happy?
Just as you come to the end of the hallway, you spot two people you don't recognize. They're both girls, and they're making out. Hard.
One of them is definitely cheerleader material, with her long blond hair and tight miniskirt. The other one is smaller, with brunette hair and a short plaid jacket.

You continue to watch them, curious what they're up to. The big one turns and sees you, smiling wickedly.
Big Smiley: Hey, baby.
You stare at him in confusion.

What's he talkin' about?
Big Smiley: I said, hey baby. What are you, blind? I'm talking to you.

You stare at him, dumbfounded.
Big Smiley: O...kay, maybe you're not blind. Anyway, it's your lucky day, baby. You can join in and double your fun..
> You say "I will pass"

You: I'm not interested.
Big Smiley: Ah, so you're gay, huh?
You: No, I just don't swing that way.
Big Smiley: Wow, really?

Didn't think Japanese boys could say that sort of stuff.
You: Huh? What the hell do you mean?
Big Smiley: Nothing, baby. I'm just saying you're different from most Japanese boys.
> You say "Im not Japanese"

Big Smiley: Huh? Oh, sorry. Yeah, you're not Japanese. You look more Asian.
You: How'd you know?
Big Smiley: I just known. You're American, right?

You: Yeah...
Big Smiley: You look sad. Where are you going?
You: Nowhere.
Big Smiley: I have to go too. Would you like to come to my house?
> You say "What do you mean with going to your house"

You: What do you mean with going to your house?
Big Smiley: Well, why else would I invite you to come with me? I have a pool.
You: ...
Your mind tells you no, but your body

is telling you to yes. Yes is what you do.
Big Smiley: I know right? Come on, I live close by, it won't take long.
You: Alright.

Big Smiley: You ready?
You: Yeah... I guess so.
Big Smiley: Alrighty then.

Follow me.
The two of you leave the school premises and walk to Big Smiley's house. Luckily it isn't too far away, and the entire time you have a bad feeling about everything.
> You say "Narrator tell me if I fucked it up"

You: Now tell me if I'm doing this right
Big Smiley seems pretty nice, right?
You: Uh, yeah...
Big Smiley: Yeah, me too.

Don't we know it.
Big Smiley takes you to his pool, which is not actually a pool but an above-ground pool filled with water. It's pretty though.
Big Smiley: I want to introduce you to my pet. (Introduction of her pet: a regular, non-fucking giant turtle) So yeah, this is Hazel.
You: Hey, turtle.

Hazel: Gah!
Big Smiley: Shh! Be nice!
You: I will. Do you have a pool stick?
Big Smiley: What?

You know, to play with.

You: Could I have one?

You go and grab one, while Big Smiley goes to his house.
You: Now what?

You: Okay.
You are standing in front of a table with several pool cues.
You: So, what's the game?
Big Smiley: 9-ball. You like that, right?

You: Yeah.
Big Smiley: Alright then, let's get started.
You begin to grab several sticks and begin to look for a table.

You see one in the middle of the room, which is pretty big but has several cigarette holes in it. Looks like a good table. Then you see on another table in the room two bottles. Looks like alcoholic drinks.

Then you see two more tables in the room, which are smaller and square; they must be considered bitches.
So far you like this place.
You: So what do I do with the stick?

Big Smiley: You break this game.
You: Really?
Big Smiley: Well sure. You don't think I know how to play, do you?

Of course I know how to play pool. I'm not a complete moron.
You: No, no, I know you're not a moron. I just... I've never played before.

Big Smiley: Never?
You: Nah. I never had the chance or something.
Big Smiley: Well, you don't need to worry about that. I'll teach you how to play.

You: Really?
Big Smiley: Yeah, of course. I mean, this isn't really my area of expertise, but I'll try to do my best.
> You say "Tkz"

You: OK, what do I do first?
Big Smiley: Well, we're going to go over some rules.
Big Smiley grabs a pool stick and shows you how to hold it.

Big Smiley: Like this.
You: What's this for?
Big Smiley: So you don't drop it. And keep your thumb up by the tip here...

Big Smiley begins to tell you the basic rules of pool.
You: But what's tkz?
Big Smiley: The two-stick? Oh, that's a rule.

You can't use just one pool stick, you need a second one.

That's what the stick is there for.
You: What happens if I break it?
Big Smiley: You go to jail. And you also go to jail, if you break the table.
> You say "do not damage privatw propietry, ok noted"

You begin to play your first game of pool. You put the cue ball in the corner.

Big Smiley beats your shot again.
Big Smiley: Good luck.
You: What's the point of this?

You: I mean, I don't get it.

The best players in the world are never able to fully predict where the other player is going to shoot the next ball. It all comes down to pure skill.
You: But I don't get it.

Big Smiley: Well, maybe it is and you just haven't heard of it.
You: What do you mean?
Big Smiley: I don't know, man.

I mean I guess it just sort of lost ground because there were better things to do with your time, but I still think it's a pretty cool game.
You: So, what's next?

Big Smiley nods.
> You say "So be it"

> You say "What do you mean by little"

He reaches down and picks up the pool stick.

Then he makes a loud crack and you can feel the wood of the cue splinter into your hand.

This is what you'll be playing with.
He walks away from you and grabs a pool ball which he proceeds to chalk. Then, he places it on the table.

> You say "Why dont we play DotA"

.

> You say "What?"

You: (Sigh) No.
Big Smiley: Well then, you'll need to learn. It's pretty straight forward. We each get five categories. I can go in any category you pick, and you can go in any category I pick.

The categories are:
Big Smiley starts to go into the different types of milk, eggs, meat, fruits and vegetables.
> You say "Oh that."
Big Smiley: Oh that. Well, it's pretty simple. It's winner takes all. The category I pick is yours to lose, and the category you pick is mine to win.

So if I go for uh... Eggs, and you go for... Apples, well that's one win for you and one loss for me.

actions.text: Adventurer

's Guild
"It'll take about a year to train her," says the guild representative.
"We'll put her in the Gloom, low risk, high reward position. She'll receive basic combat training, wilderness survival, tracking and other things that will be useful for her line of work.
For that year, she'll be fairly paid and given food, a place to sleep and other basic needs. We'll give her a weapon when she starts. If she fails, she dies. It's that simple.
If she succeeds, she lives, but most likely as a free woman, with all her gifts and talents paid for. She'll also be sent on missions, to increase her life and death chances, if you wish.

We can also equip her with better gear. We, unlike the Empire, do have some silvers to spare."
"What's the catch?" you ask, raising an eyebrow. The representative smiles back.
"
Well, there isn't one right now, but once she starts her training... That's when the deal gets interesting. She's an Eternal, you see. This means that we have certain...

expectations of her. If she fails to meet them, then it won't matter how good of a killer or fighter she is. We'll just have to get rid of her."
"

Oh?"
"Yes. We expect her to join us. All of us. All the eternals.
We're wanderers, much like the Syndicate. We mostly travel in small groups and hide as best we can when we settle down. But that's not to say we don't have organization.
We have a few main cities, though some of us prefer to just move around and settle in the most inhabitable places.

It's a bit of a home for eternals, similar to how the military is for humans. We have a lot of similar interests, after all."
"You want her to join you."
"
Well, yes. Why else would she be here? I mean, if you don't want her around after her training is over, then that's fine. But I thought you were an adventurer. Adventures travel.

That's why we're here. To travel. To see the world."
"Yes... I suppose I am.

And I will. But I have to ask: what are you expecting from her?"
"A lot. But not all of it is that unreasonable. We want her to join us.
As I said, it's a home and a lot of us, all of the eternals, actually. We have a lot of fun and enjoy each others' company.

We even have slaves that we treat well. The eternal slaves, that is. They're a bit different, but for the most part, we treat them as well as we treat our traveling employees."
"

What do you mean?" you ask.
"Well, for one, they're much shorter lived.
For two, they're practically children in many ways. They have the most fun, too. So it's in their best interests that they be happy. And that means letting them enjoy their lives as long as possible.
> You say "Point"

"That's another thing we want from her. We want you to join us."
"What?

Why?" you ask.
"Why not? You've lived a pretty interesting life so far, traveling and all that. You're young yet, despite how old you may seem.
We can point you in the right direction. It would be really great if you joined us. Think of it like this: you get to travel and have fun, all while helping to train a potential successor.

If you're nice to her, then when you're old you'll get to enjoy her company. And maybe even have a bit of fun with her yourself. What could be better?"
"

I don't know... maybe training a potential eternal b..."
"Who said anything about eternals? We want her to succeed, but we don't need some old fogey like you teaching her.
She needs to learn from real adventure. C'mon, you'd be really great at this. You'd finally have a group that'll accept you as a proper adult.
> You say "Do it"

"Done."
"Good." The representative smiles.

"We can get started right away. Let's go."
You are lead into a large building and up stairs. The people there give you curious looks, but don't say anything.
They just go about their business as you're being lead in. Once you reach a floor that has a lot of doors along the left side of it, the guide leads you into one the doors and motions you inside.

A teenage girl with long curly red hair and bright red eyes looks up at you from her chair. She immediately gets up and hugs you.
"You came back!" she says with a huge smile.

"When?"
"Just a few minutes ago. I'm here to train you."
"That's so great! I was wondering when I would see you again."

The girl has really nice hugs.
"Well, I'm here now." You sit down at the desk and motion her to do likewise.

"I think we should start with some introductions, don't you agree?"
"Yes!" the girl beams. "I'm Ruby.

Are you our master?"
"No, I'm not their master." You motion for her to stop. "In fact, their master is on his way here right now, I just got a little ahead of myself.

I'm sure he'll be here soon."
"Oh," Ruby frowns a bit. "I was hoping you would be our master."
You laugh. "I aim to disappoint.

Now, shall we get started?"
"Sure!
Whatever you say!

I'll be happy to learn whatever you want to teach me."
"Alright then," you lean over and look at one of the many notebooks on her desk. "What would you like to know?"
"

Oh, well I'd like to know more about the world and... well... some magic!" She states the last bit with great enthusiasm.
"Okay then," you flip open the notebook and start writing. "

What would you like to know about the world?"
"Well... I'd like to know how it got to the state it's in now."
You start drawing a rough map.
"

The world used to be a much smaller size, with a lot more land. Then the Old Man came and did something with magic I guess, and it made the world bigger."
"That's so strange!

I didn't know that."
"Yeah, it was strange at the time, even by Old Man standards. Now the world is broken up into islands.
Some have airships, some don't. Some have magic, some don't. It's a crazy world and getting crazier.

You should see some of the places the airships have crashed into."
"That must have been so cool!" Ruby looks at you with great interest. "

Do you go to such places?"
"No," you shake your head with a smile. "I stay off the airships whenever possible. I try to never get too far away from my island.

> You ask for a report.

"Ragnor, how did it go?"
"It went great! The men had fun, and I got supplies to last us until the winter. You know how to deal with the villagers, correct?"
"Yeah. I got a bunch of them killed.

Any women or children?"
"Sadly, no. I wish it had been different, but defending the village from a siege doesn't work out too well for them.
> You say "Are you sure that none of them escape"

"Are you sure that none of them escape? I heard someone screaming a while ago..."
"No. No one escaped. The villagers were all dead.
> You say "Good we have to keep it quiet, the king's army can not know we are here"

"Good we have to keep it quiet, the king's army can not know we are here"
"Let's keep it that way then. No rumours, got it."
You look around, before nodding.
> You say "If we keep this pace we can get to the capital in 3 days"

"If we keep this pace we can get to the capital in 3 days"
You nod, before continuing the march.
You walk slowly, heading towards the capital. The march is uneventful, although you are all getting pretty hungry by the end of it.
You decide to make camp for the day, and take the opportunity to give your soldiers a break. You know they are all pretty tired from the battle.
> You say "Any news from the front"

"Any news from the front"
"I heard something from Ragnor, he said that they are making great strides with the siege.

We should have the capital before long."
"Hm, we'll get there before they do then. I heard there was a battle yesterday, you weren't in it were you?"
"

No, but I heard we suffered some losses."
"Oh... Yeah Ragnor told me about that too, but only some.

We can still recover from it."
"Yeah, I know... We'll get there first."
The young woman gives the ghost a smile, before getting up and stretching.
"

I'm gonna go ahead and make camp, it's not like anyone is stopping me."
She begins unbuttoning her shirt and begins to remove it, before pausing.
"
Oh screw it, might as well go for a swim naked while I'm at it.

Night" she says, before running away. The other men in your company burst into laughter, as you shake your head.
"She's a bit like you aren't she?" One of them jokes.
"

A little." You agree.
"I'll go tell the scouts where we're making camp for the day.
You should relax as well, you're losing your edge if you're telling jokes in the middle of the day.
We're approaching the outskirts of a large city, chances are we'll have lots of fighting today, so you need to be fully awake for it.
If we don't fight today, we'll probably be fighting in the city tomorrow, so you still need to be fully awake for that one.
If we do fight in the city, it's a big place, so you need to be fully awake for that one too.
The whole time.
> You say "We are taking the capital tomorrow there are a lot of preparations to be made"

"We are taking the capital tomorrow there are a lot of preparations to be made"
The scout looks up at the sky and nods.

"You're right. It is getting dark, we should be making camp."
The men quickly collect their gear and start to set up tents. You look up at the sky and nod.

"Let's get some fires going then."
The men quickly work to light fires, and you stand over them as they cook up rations.
Your soldiers are silent, all exhausted from the day's events.
You all stand in an arc, the soldiers on your left and right silent. You begin to focus, and the silent march begins. You begin counting in your head, from one hundred. Then two hundred...
As you reach three hundred, the scouts on the outskirts report back that the city is visible. The men cook up rations for you, and you take a few bologna sandwiches and some water bottles.
You eat quickly, as the men begin shouting. You give a few quick orders, before standing slowly with your hands in your pockets.
"Alright, we're going to take the city. Anyone who wants to fight, fight. Anyone who doesn't, stay here and help look after the camp. We've got it from here."
After a few minutes, you begin to walk towards the city. As you approach, the soldiers stand at attention. You stare ahead blankly, as the men in front stare proudly at you.

The scouts on the outskirts keep watch, ready to run and signal everyone if hostile forces are spotted. You all begin moving silently forward.
Suddenly, the scout on the outside breaks into a run.
> You say "They didnt expect us to be here, the city is almost defenseless"

"They didn't expect us to be here, the city is almost defenseless"
You walk with your men into the city.
The guns have been taken off your scouts, in order for them to take care of the people of the city with their bare hands. They move silently, and you stare ahead blankly.
> You say "Quickly lets take the citadel"
You begin running, your men following suit. You run through the streets in the middle of the city, before skidding to a halt in front of a wall.

You stare at it blankly for a few seconds, before Ragnor begins barking orders.
"Scalperes, prepare for battle! Testudos, tight formation!"
Men in plated leather armor, carrying long pikes, circle you. To your right, a group of men equipped with small round shields and gladiator-like helmets, called "testudos"
, form a tight formation. In the middle, Ragnor dressed in a white and blue suit of armor stands, a large two-handed sword in his hands.
You look around, before a massive boom deafens you. You turn, to see a massive hole in the wall of the city.
A man stands there, wearing a mailshirt, with a massive longbow aimed at Ragnor. You begin sprinting towards him, as Ragnor barked a command.

"Sextant! Arrow!"
Men begin sprinting out of the holes in the wall, pointing their arrows at you. You break into a sprint, and leap forward.
You fly towards the archer, your bare hands curled around his neck. You raise him into the air, before you slam him into the wall. The force of the blow kills him instantly, his neck broken.
You drop him to the ground, before turning. You see an arrow flying in your direction. You raise your hand, grabbing it with your fingers and pulling it from the air.
You send the arrow back, releasing it as the man reloads. You rush forward, hitting the man with a heavy punch. He tumbles to the ground, as you kick him in the head.
> You say "Forward!"

You begin punching the man, as he tries to crawl away. You step forward, and Ragnor yells "Sextant! Arrow!"
You leap backward, as an arrow flies by.
You stare at the man, as he struggles to get up. Suddenly, another boom deafens you, as you see the wall has collapsed. You turn, to see a man in plate armor aiming a bow at you.
You charge forward, your fist smashing into his face. You feel a bolt go into your side, before you send the man to the ground with a heavy punch.
You turn, as you see an arrow flying through the air. You dive out of the way, as the arrow passes just above you. You get up, running forward and tackling the archer.
You grab the bow, and throw it to the ground with your foot. You punch the man in the face, before he grabs his face and pulls out the bolt, looking at it and screaming.
> You say "Let capture the citadel"

"Let capture the citadel"
You stare at the man, as he struggles to get up. You grab his pauldron, and pull him up.
You grab him by the ear, and force him to march forward. You hear a bell ringing, and you realize its your own. You pull the man up, and he stares at you with hatred.
He lets out a howl, which is echoed by the rest of the soldiers. You pull your sword, and stab him through the throat.
He collapses to the ground, bleeding out. You look at the rest of the soldiers, who stare at you in terror. You let out a growl, which is echoed by the rest of the soldiers.

You grab the man by the head, and toss him over the battlements. You stare at him, before letting him fall.
You look down at the city.
The citadel, the heart of the city, is heavily damaged. Catapult fire has caused the death of many strong men, and shaken others.
> You say "We finally made it"

"We finally made it"
You yell with joy, and begin running towards the citadel. The last two men follow you. You see the bodies of the men you killed earlier, riddled with bolts.
> You say "Now they will have to retreat from the front"
You grab the two men, and begin scaling the wall with them. You reach the top of the wall, and stare at the battle. The King sits slumped over on the ground.
You yell with rage, and charge into the fray. You swing your sword, and it soars through the air.
The enemy commander stands between you and him. He fires a bolt at you, which embeds in your shoulder. You howl, and the commander speeds away on his horse.
You raise your blade, and it glances off his helmet. You grab the helmet, and rip it off. You bare your teeth, and growl. The commander stares at you, fear filling his eyes.

undoneWindow.text:
"Now they will have to retreat from the front"
You see an enemy soldier, a Turric warrior. You grab your longbow, and aim. You pull the trigger, releasing the string.
The arrow flies forward, passing through the man's eye. You pull the string again, as your two companions begin firing arrows into the Turric armies. In seconds, hundreds of bodies litter the field.
You reach the gate, where a large crowd of citizens awaits you. They let out a cheer, throwing flowers and home grown vegetables at you.

"Huzzah, for the king!"
"Huzzah, for the king!"
They let out another cheer as you approach.
You grab a crossbow from a dead body, and quickly reload it. You aim it at the citadel, and let fire. You fire arrow after arrow at the citadel, before stopping to reload.
Flames lurch out of the citadel, and you can smell the scent of roasting flesh from the city. Below the battlements, your soldiers are huddled together, terrified.
You allow the man to live, and he is made a citizen of the city. He thanks you, before collapsing. You tell your men to take the men back to camp.

You grab the arrow, pulling it out and flinging it to the ground. You stand, grabbing the man's sword and breaking it over his back.
"Who are you?"
"Cain!"

He rolls to his knees, as you smash a heavy punch into his face. He falls back, out of sight.
"Scalperes! Testudos! Retreat!"
You hear a dozen replies.
You turn, to see an arrow drilling towards you. You raise your hands, and the arrow flies straight through them. You let out a horrified scream, before the world goes black.

You turn quickly, to find yourself staring at the scout from earlier, who looks terrified.
"Get off!" You say, pushing him away.
People begin shouting everywhere.
You can sense the minds of the monsters that lurk in the city. A few half-formed thoughts reach you. A lot of them are scared, a few are ready to fight to the death.

Got it?"
"Got it!
Thanks Cern!

I'm serious, you need to take a break."
Your words are met with silence, as the men start to grumble.
"I didn't hear you arguing captain." You say.
"Well...
> You say "Remember that we cant be seen here, dont go too far"

"Remember that we cant be seen here, dont go too far"
You shake your head. This is a pretty high risk thing to do, don't do it unless you really want to.

You also wonder why she would do this in the first place, when travelling through a ghost-infested forest is a bit unnerving.
"Remember that we cant be seen here, dont go too far."

The young woman shrugs, before turning around, it looks like she is going to remove her pants too, but pauses once more.
"How do I know that you'll even keep your word?" she asks.

"News from the front?" Jane asks.
"Yeah, has anyone heard any news from the front?"
"Not much. We know there was a battle, and that we won. That's it."
"We need to find something to eat by the end of the day, or we won't have enough strength to break the spell tomorrow."

"Good we have to keep it quiet, the king's army can not know we are here"
You nod in agreement, and continue moving forward.
> You say "Casualities?"

"Yeah, three men didn't make it back. I'm sorry to tell you, but..."
Your face darkens as your best friend tells you this. He wasn't supposed to be one of the casualties.
> You say "Report"

"We need to report this," you say.
"What? Why?" Castus asks.

You walk out of the village, staring at the charred corpses that were once your people. You sigh, rubbing your head.
"Alright men, let's get going. We've got a long way to go."

You raise an eyebrow, knocking on the door. You hear footsteps from inside, before it's opened up.
"Hey, tall guy. Get out of my house!" a man says.

He's quite a large man. Almost as large as you. You open your mouth to respond, but he keeps talking.
"I'm warning you, I'll kill you,"

Wait... I know! I remember! It's-
"I have no idea, sir," Ragnor says.
> You say "I dont care anyway"

"Alright," you say, "Just lead the way."
"I don't know the way, sir."
"For God's sake, Ragnor, you're a ghoul. You'd know the way there if it was surrounded by villages!" you exclaim, annoyed that he hasn't remembered.
> You say "Your next phrase is "Buenos dias Mandy""

You say "Good day Mandy"
You feel a sharp pain run through your head as you hear a voice from all directions at the same time.

"Good morning Mandy" you say, hoping that will cheer her up.
It works, if only a little.
"Oh...You're up..." She says.
"Yes, I am."
MANDY: "Oh come on, I didn't expect you to worry about me that much!" She laughs.

You take a deep breath, as your lungs gasp for more air.
"Bue-oh-nas day... Mandy."
You feel your tongue roll across your dry mouth as you utter the words.

"Goddammit..." You mutter as you sit up, gingerly feeling your head.

"Oh don't touch it! Don't touch it!" A voice screams.

Once again, you are at the mercy of someone who wants to use you for your body.
As you stand up and shake the cobwebs from your head, you notice that you are once again naked.
You look around you and find that not only are you in a fairly nice room by demon standards, but (you blink) you're also in the middle of a fairly normal-looking human village.

"You will be given clothes." A voice calls out to you.
As if on command, you begin to receive clothes. First, some tight fitting leggings are sent to you.

Then your long underwear is exchanged for some loose fitting cotton pants. Then comes the shirt, which is tied at the waist with a nice leather belt. Last of all you receive some boots that fit your feet.
You begin to hear a voice in your head. At first you think its Ruby, but it's not the same as before. It's dark, cold and hard.
You wake up and it's like someone has poured molten steel into your body. You want to die. You wish you were already dead.
You hear a voice behind you say "Buenos dias Mandy" You turn your head slightly and see a woman with curly black hair and brown eyes behind reading glasses.

"Good day Mandy"
You hear a voice say in your head. You are so stunned that you can't move, or react in any way.
The voice returns.

You see several strange people in robes standing around a table, looking down at something on a plate.
What you see makes you want to vomit.

Your stomach turns, and you feel the bile rising in your throat as you look at what is on the table.
It's your sister. She's cut open...

You take out your sword and attempt to channel that anger into something useful. You swing your sword, but Ruby stops you.
"Wait, why are you angry? You're venting energy that you could be using!"

Best results: press enter if nothing shows up.
Or only press enter to see what the ai comes up with.

Events:
Egg
Ended (date unknown)
Potato has endded 
7/31-8/4

actions.text:
‎
‎ ‎‎
‎ ‎‎
‎ ‎‎
"What's going on?" "What happened?
> You say "Do it"
The men don't question you, they just do it. They quickly grab you and the little girl, holding your hands above your head as they stab you repeatedly with a sharpened stick.
> You say "Do it"
They stab you in the neck, and you go limp.
> You say "Do it"
The men don't question you, they just do it. They quickly grab you and the little girl, holding your hands above your head as they stab you repeatedly with a sharpened stick.
> You say "Do it"

They stab you in the neck, and you go limp.
"Well, you're not dead yet. Shall we continue?"
> You do it.
The bandits drag you and the girl to their hideout. They push you down on your knees, while the little girl holds your hand.
> You do it.

The girl begins to plead with you.
"You'll save me, right? Please, I'm scared."
The bandits cut your throat.
> You say "That was a genjutsu"

The bandits begin laughing and cheer.
"Wat! It wasn't a genjutsu! You're dead!"
You laugh and sit up.
"That was for my little sister."

You show your bloody throat.
The bandits stare at you in horror, then begin shouting and running away.
"BLOODY LITTLE... I HATE YOU!"

You sit up, finding your sister standing before you, a blood-soaked sword in her hands.
"H-h-how do you feel?"
She looks down at you, sighing.

"I'm scared... and I'm angry. What were you thinking, trying to save a human?"
"I..."
She lunges at you, stabbing you through the chest.

You stare at her, sighing.
"I'm sorry I didn't save you. If I had the power, I would have."
Your sister stares at you, coldly smiling.
"Good-bye, big brother. Thank you for saving me."
Your vision fades to black.
> You meet God.

You wake up in a white room.
"Ah, you're up. You looked so peaceful, I didn't want to disturb you."
A young man stands before you.
He looks to be in his early thirties, though he seems much older than that. He has a monotone voice and dresses in a monochrome outfit, which consists of a white jacket and trousers.

"Who are you?"
"My name is God. Well, technically, it's G-god-d-dammit-it's not important! What matters is, we've been watching you.

Watching your actions. Watching your life."
"We?"
"Anon, do you really think a god would reveal himself to a mere human? If you think so, you're more delusional than I thought.

No, we've had gods watching you since before you were born. We've been reading your thoughts. We've had an eye on you ever since you decided to get up off your lazy rear end and live."
"

Who are you to decide when I should or shouldn't live?"
"Anon, do you really think a god would reveal himself to a mere human? If you think so, you're more delusional than I thought.

No, we've had gods watching you since before you were born. We've been reading your thoughts. We've had an eye on you ever since you decided to get up off your lazy rear end and live."
"

Who are you to decide when I should or shouldn't live?"
"Anon, do you really think a god would reveal himself to a mere human? If you think so, you're more delusional than I thought.
> You say "So you are going to revive me or sonething"
God sighs.
> You say "What"
"I'm going to give you a chance, anon. Get out of that rusted cage you've been living in. Get a new name. Start a new life."

"A new life? But where?"
"Where do you want to live, anon?"
"Anywhere. Anywhere but here."
"I see. So where do you want to live?"
> You say "Medieval fantasy wold"

"I see. So you would like to live in a time when half the people you come across want to carve you open and drink your blood?"
"What?! No!"
"Then what?
> You say "I dont care as long as you make me owerpowered"
"You're living in a cage, anon.
> You say "Thats not so hard for you"

"What is it you want?"
"I want you to make me overpowered."
"Well, that is a tall order. I don't make the rules, anon. I only give you your powers."
"Can you make me powerful?

"What do you think?"
You rise up off the bed, floating a few inches above the ground.
"Well, that's different.
> You say "I meat to one shot everithing in my path"

"Oh. Well, I'm sorry to tell you this, but that's not very realistic."
You land on your bed with a thud.
"Why the hell not? It's true!
> You say "Wathever just do it already"

"I have. It doesn't work like that."
"Why the hell not? It's true!

"I've told you before, I don't make the rules. Only God does."
"Why the hell not? It's true!
"Can we change the subject?

You seem to be getting agitated.
"No! Why the hell not? It's true!
"Why the hell not? It's true!"
God sighs.
"

Fine, it's true. Are we done here?"
"I'm not done until you give me what I want! Why the hell not? It's true!"
"Why the hell not? It's true!
> You say "Do it"
You fall to the ground.

"Why the hell not? It's true!"
"Oh for fucks sake..."
God grabs you and presses his palm against your chest. You feel an explosion of power inside you, like when someone takes the Energy Potion, but ten times stronger.

You feel the blood inside your body start to get warm, then boil.
"Why the hell not? It's true!"
"Are you finished?"
"No!"
God grabs you again and presses his palm against your chest. This time, you feel like all the air in your lungs has been sucked out of them.

It's a strange sensation. Your head starts to feel very heavy, like you want to fall asleep for the rest of your life.
"Why the hell not? It's true!

"I'm..."
You can't talk, you can't think, you can't move. Everything starts to get dark, and then all goes black.

"I was hoping it wouldn't come to this."
You wake up outside the cage, lying in the grass.

"You see now, don't you?"
You look up, and you see a man standing over you. He's wearing a long, red robe, and a skullcap. You recognize him as God.

"Why did you do this to me?" you ask. "Can you at least tell me that?"
"I gave you your powers, and your abilities. Isn't it enough?"
You want to cry, but you can't. Instead, you stand up, shaking off the dirt.

"What now?"
"Now? Now, you go back to your boring, mundane life. Try not to die too much in combat, alright?"
You nod.
"Thank you, God."

"You're welcome, anon."
You turn to leave, but as you do so, you notice that your cage is gone. You walk back over to God.

"Can I ask why you did this? I mean, I understand why you did it to me, but why did you do this to the elves?"
"The elves?

Well, they asked for it."
"What?"
"The elves asked for it. Don't you know anything? People just like to blame me for the bad things that happen in this world.
I don't even do it on purpose! The humans bred an overly large population of them, so I had to send a bunch of them back. Not my fault if they got themselves killed or not.

But don't you dare blame this on me and leave this world with a bunch of unanswered questions. That's your job."
"My job? But..."
"
But nothing. Now, I suggest you go back before you die of old age.

Don't want you outliving your purpose, after all."
You stare at God in disbelief.
"I'm sorry?" you say.
"I said don't you dare die on me now, old man!

You're supposed to be the good examples! Don't you know anything about necromancers?"
"Um... I've heard stories."
"Then you know that's not a job you want to have.

It's dangerous and pointless."
"I... I had no idea..."
"You're not supposed to know. That's why I'm doing this. So you don't make the same mistake I did."
"

What mistake is that?"
"Giving up. Goodbye, for now.
> You leave God and go to a random place.
You walk away from the God and decide to leave this place for now. You feel like you need a moment by yourself. You look around at all the dead trees.
This place seems so peaceful yet so... dead. The sky has a definite colorless feel to it, like you're not really seeing the sky so much as you're watching a graphic that's depicting the sky.

It gives off a feel of loneliness and depression.
Then, you spot something out of place in the distance. It looks like a small cottage made out of sticks and dirt.
> You say "So, you are aproaching me?"

You approach the cottage and a voice from inside the cottage answers.
"Yes, I am approaching you."
The voice is gruff and deep, yet it has a pleasant undertone.
The speaker is a man dressed in old, tattered clothing. He seems very tall, even for a human, and his eyes are particularly wide.

"Are you a spirit?" you ask. "Because I need to talk to you."
"You need to die."
"Do I... know you?
> You say "So be it"

"No, I don't think we've met. My name is Vasi."
Vasi sits down on the ground and props his walking stick against his shoulder while he continues to look at you.
"I assume you're here about the afterlife, since you seem to be confused about a lot of things."

"Yes, I am. I don't know what's going to happen to me."
"Neither do I."
Vasi sits in silence for a moment, contemplating the possibilities.

"Well, let's see. Are you married? Kids?"
"I don't have a family."
"Sorry to hear that. So, do you have a religion?"
"No.

I don't believe in anything."
"Me neither. So, let's get started. What would you like to know?"
"Everything."
"Well, let's see...
First off, there's no such thing as heaven or hell. We're just energy. Eventually, we stop existing altogether. At least, that's what I believe happens.
Second, I was once human, but I don't know what happens to us after death. Finally, there are two types of spirits. Good ones, like myself, and the occasional bad one that causes chaos.

I'm neutral, so I don't cause any chaos, but I know a lot of bad ones. Anyway, there are books that can tell you more. You'll see them soon."
"What do you mean?

How do I get there?"
"You didn't think you'd just instantly be transported to these ethereal planes right after death, did you?"
"Well, no."
"You have to earn it.

By doing good deeds. And learning."
Vasi stands up and stretches, turning around in a circle to take in his new surroundings. He stops and points towards the trees.
"
That way is the woods. You should explore it. There are books there that can answer many of your questions. There are also other spirits out there, and some of them are very knowledgeable.
> You say "Go to a town"

"Oh, yes. You'll want to go to a town eventually. It's the best way to learn more."
Vasi leads you through the trees and out towards the edge of the forest.

"This is it. Your life is over. You can continue living, or you can die here. It's up to you."
You look at Vasi. He seems so... relaxed. So carefree.

So happy.
You turn, and see a beautiful garden with a small river running through it. You slowly walk over to the river, and dip your hand into the water. It's ice-cold.
You step into the river and let the water flow over you. It's a beautiful sensation.
As you walk out of the river, you suddenly feel a fist hitting you in the back. Your lungs inflate with water, and you slowly sink to the bottom of the river.
> You use a 1000000 volt thunder storm to fry everithing 100 meter around you.

You create a static discharge, shocking all nearby creatures.
Your enemies begin to writhe in pain and flail about. Some are sent flying into trees and are electrocuted on contact.
It takes a few seconds for the damage to be done, but in the end, all creatures are dead. The air is completely charged with electricity.
> You say "Hardly a chalenge"

"Well said. Let's get on with our journey then."
You continue your journey alongside Vasi, who looks exactly as he did when you first met him.
"So, where are we going?"

You ask.
"You'll see in time. But for right now, let's get to the graveyard."
The streets are empty, since it's too early in the morning.

You walk down the sidewalk, and Vasi stays on his path.
"I know this guy..." He says.
You arrive at a small, run-down graveyard.

A few broken headstones lay in the ground, and weeds are starting to take over.
"Here it is." Vasi says.

"It's so run down." You say.
"Well, it is run down. I don't take care of it. But come on, we're not staying."
He begins walking towards the woods. You follow, and soon enough, you arrive at a small, old cabin in the middle of the forest. There's no smoke, so it seems like nobody's around.

"Well, this is it."
Vasi walks into the cabin without waiting for an answer. You follow, and soon find yourself in a kitchen.

There's a single, dirty kitchen knife on the table. You look around, and find yourself in a cabin that's not much bigger than a prison cell.
"Vasili! You're back!"

A voice shouts from upstairs.
"Who's there?" You ask.
"Who do you think? I'm your sister! And who's your little friend?"
"I'm not..."

"I know you're not little brother. You're a man now, and way too old to be playing with dolls. Who's this?"
You look up to see a young woman, around your age.
She has long, curly brown hair, and is lean and fit from years of living in the woods. She's holding an infant in her arms, and seems quite attached to it.
"This is Mikhail. He's a nice boy, but a little simple. Not much of a talker. Don't worry, though, he'll grow up to be a strong hunter just like his father."

"Nice to meet you Mikhail." You say, smiling.
The girl giggles, and takes the baby into another room.
You hear the sound of bedsprings, and she returns with a boy about your age. He has her hair, and green eyes, but he's much taller and leaner.

"This is my little brother Yolev. He'll be going on many more hunts with you, he's that kind of guy."
You nod, and the two brothers go outside to play in the dirt.

"So... you wanted to talk to me?" The girl asks.
